"Not really. There's something else." Smeargle gets comfy, lazily reaching for a bag of berries near the couch, and offers you a berry. Not having eaten anything the entire day, you accept it, Smeargle eating the rest of the berries and showering you with bits of it while he talked.

"I dunno what was the whole thing between Furret and you, but you warned us about him" Munch munch "You should have told us instead of trying to get into the tree yourself, so I'm not apologizing for your stay in my partner's body" You're not surprised to hear he's not sorry about it. You magnanimously decide to stay silent. "So I decided to make you welcome into the tree as a small reward. You're not a guest, though" Munch munch "You're my roommate"

"Wait, what?"

"Don't make that face! The tree is a good place to live in, why do you think so many Pokemon try to sneak in without a mark? And since you're so small you're not going to be any bother. And I want to keep an eye on you anyway, so you don't cause trouble around" So that was the reason: he didn't want you running around in the tree or its nearby areas without authorization. You had exchanged Furret for Smeargle in terms of what Pokemon had some sort of grip on you.

To be frank, you were glad for that. Smeargle was unpleasant, but he sure wasn't eating innocent 'mons!

Once you had your fill of berry, you let it go, Smeargle doesn't hesitate and eats it too, letting you rest. You lean back on the coarse fur of his torso, putting your hands behind your head, and close your eyes. The nice coolness of the hovel, the late time at night, and the muffled sound of Smeargle's stomach digesting berries underneath you are making you feel relaxed, maybe even happy.

It was a rather long and stressful day, a day you spent worried about a monster eating innocent Pokemon. Despite everything, now that the day was over, you realized you were rather lucky. Not only Furret was defeated, you also had managed to somehow earn a safe place to live in -- and Smeargle wasn't...that bad? You were willing to get along with him, as long as he made some effort too, and in your opinion, giving you food was a good step forward. Yes, for once, you feel like despite your size, your situation isn't bad at all!

A blast of warm air hits you. You open one eye, seeing Smeargle's snout very close to you. Smeargle is staring right at you with what you interpret as an uncomfortable expression. You have the sudden feeling he's been staring at you for a while already. "Sorry, did I do something wrong?"

"...I'm about to go to bed" he said.

"Oh, okay. I'll stay on the couch--"

"I want to ask you a favor"

"Sure, what is it?"

Smeargle swallows. You didn't think he could look hesitant, yet here he was, like he wasn't sure how to talk. "...I want you to spend the night inside my butt" All that comes out of you is a funny noise like confused babbling. Smeargle bops you on the head with a finger. "Listen and please don't interrupt me, it's hard enough to say these things.

Every time the situation warrants it Stoutland imprisons unwelcome invaders inside his butt. At first I didn't pay much attention to that, but then I started wondering why he likes that so much"

"Uh-huh..."

"Everything down there is for pushing things out, why would something crawling in be any good? It doesn't make any sense!"

"Uh-huh..." you repeated again. You're pretty sure you know where this is going.

"And it's not like I can just ask any Pokemon to do that for me, because nothing would fit in. But I was just looking at you and then I realized: you...you're the smallest thing I have ever seen! I'm pretty sure you'd fit inside me! If there's someone who can help me with this, it's you!"

"Right..." you saw that coming.

Smeargle continues: "I'm just asking you to be inside for the rest of the night, until the morning"

You're not sure why, but you don't immediately veto that. Maybe it's because you're in a very good mood right now, or because he fed you and pretty much gave you a place to stay in, or maybe just that you don't want to sour the budding...tolerance you have towards each other. The hope you see in Smeargle's eyes isn't helping either. If it wasn't because he's asking you to go into his rectum you'd think it was adorable.

"Just...one night?"

"Only one. That should be enough" At least he was honest about his motives. Pure curiosity was better than many other reasons.

You turn your head around from your vantage point on his belly, giving a cursory look at his size. Smeargle lacked Stoutland's massiveness, but he wasn't small. His head easily reached Stoutland's shoulders, after all. You calculated that, if you were to stand inside Smeargle's colon, you could extend your hand upwards and reach the ceiling with ease.

You really hated by now that kind of calculations were easy for you to make.

"I don't know if I should..."

Smeargle sighs, his breath washing over you. You smell berries. "I know. If you say no it's fine. But I'd appreciate if you accepted"

You're very relieved to find out he doesn't intend to shove you in if you don't want to partake in this. You turn around. You see the expanse of Smeargle's belly, before it curves down. It's almost hard to believe that, if you chose so, you could feasibly reach Smeargle's tailhole in a minute or two of walking.

Finally, you take your decision.
114111121212112113222121211222222232111.title: All is Well That Ends Well -- For Around an Hour

choices: Nope! One nappy nap later, it’s morning. Sun’s shining, though you can’t see it.
You feel Smeargle stir in the dead of night…
You hear a strange sound at midnight. A voice? A gurgle?
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
Resting amongst the sea of Smeargle’s tan-white fur, looking up at his oval-shaped head and ringed eyes, you can’t help but feel a strange desire to humor him.
         “Well, alright,” you say. Your words aren’t the most confident, but they prick Smeargle’s ears all the same. His ears rise, looking like two loaves of brown bread sliding up the sides of his face. His words, however, don’t exude the same amount of excitement.
         “You don’t sound sure,” he says, voice low. “You don’t have to do this. I don’t want to pressure—”
         “I’m sure.” You say. Smeargle silences in an instant. It becomes quieter than it ever has been. All you can hear is the sound of both your breaths—and gurgling of his tummy below. His berry-scented breath blows past you in a sweet wind, enriching the air with a sugary scent. You watch his fur ripple with the breeze, reminding you of the windy barley fields in all those old samurai movies.
         Smeargle looks at you expectantly. He doesn’t say a word. Judging from the blooming blush on his face, he probably doesn’t have a clue of what to say! His tongue is probably tied up in a flustered knot, and if he opened his mouth, all that would come out is blabberings. Quite a scary thought for the ordinarily articulate Smeargle!
         You spin around, leaving his puppy dog face to admire your newly-painted mark. You start your stroll down his belly fur, meandering across the meadow of white. His soft fur yields underfoot as you brush it aside and stride through. Even outside his body, you can hear his rapidly-quickening heartbeat—faint yet clear. Ba-thump, ba-thump, ba-thump…
         You snap awake when you realize you’re nearing your destination, the breadth of your memories of the trip already melted away. You’re by his crotch now and the air is heavy with his incense. You sense Smeargle shift uncomfortably as you pass by his intimate regions, and despite you not necessarily wanting to look, you do so anyway. You see it: his cock. Still nested in his sheath, a pinprick of pink already rising from its furry confinement. It twitches slightly. You don’t know what you expected. You continue on.
         You find yourself at the slope of a fluffy hill. With a second’s hesitation, you slide down it like a snow-kissed slant. It’s like sledding! Except, well, it smells a little bit like butt…
         Eventually you find yourself at the base of his tail, nested between his legs. His long, spaghetti-strand tail slinks off into the distance, cascading off the fabric couch like a wooly waterfall. You balance yourself on his tail, which is rather easy considering your size, and toddle closer to your journey’s end. A pink-flesh ring, tickled by hair and shaded by the shadow of his looming balls, patiently awaits your entry. You move closer, feet clomping against Smeargle’s tail fur. The puckered muscle is clean—thank heavens—and it doesn’t emanate a sickly odor. It doesn’t smell great, but it doesn’t make you want to turn yourself inside-out either.
         You’re next to it now. You’re questioning all of your life choices that lead up to this moment. But you’re already here, so....
         You wriggle your hands inside, worming your way past doughy flesh. Smeargle peeps a grunt as he feels your intrusion. It isn’t a hearty growl or a throaty moan. It’s just a surprised peep, the beagle perceiving an odd tickle in his backside. You part his flesh as the Normal-type hums a pleasured mmmm.... That was a different sensation.
         You press your face against the flexing muscle as your wriggle your way in. His tailhole strains, trembling, as his toes curl—the beagle trying his best to not clench his backdoor.
         The sensation! It’s unparalleled. Smeargle feels the room grow hot as a newfound pleasure lights a fire in his belly. It licks his veins with spouts of flame, injecting them with electric energy and sending a rousing pulse coursing through his body. Smeargle shivers. He has never felt this way before.
         Back to you. You’re just finishing up worming your way into the dog’s backdoor. His tailhole nibbles around your waist as you kick your legs, inching yourself in. On the inside, you see the ribbed walls of Smeargle’s colon, relatively clean and mostly free of scat. Thank goodness the beagle is the one Pokemon with good anal hygiene…
         The rest of you pops inside with a sticky slurk. You enter prone, belly on the slick floor. The familiar muggy anal environment welcomes you, dousing you in a heat rivaled only by the most sweltry of rainforests. Once you’re all in, you hear Smeargle gasp above. His voice booms around you: the head of security now the voice of Arceus. You pick yourself up, standing tall, and reach up toward the drippy roof. Your predictions were correct. You reach it easily.
         “My… my goodness!” Smeargle hushly gasps. “I think I feel you! Barely but—” His words crash to a stop as he curiously prods his lower belly. The oscillating walls grow slightly tighter, not from his finger, but his blooming excitement. “Are you okay in there?”
         “Doing… peachy!” You shout. The air still smelled a lot like the other butts you’ve been in. But this time there’s the distinct scent of Smeargle. And from the bit you’ve stayed with him, the smell oddly brings a warm fuzzy feeling in your bosom. You walk around a bit, exploring the end of his colon, your feet squelching across the ground. Smeargle’s breathing is getting louder. You place a hand on the rectum walls.
         “Are you okay, Smeargle?”
         No answer—for a moment.
         “I’m fine! I’m just… a little steamed up.” The big beagle exhales. “I’m trying not too… mmm…” Smeargle quiets down, humming deeply. You sense the ground beneath your rise slightly before settling back down. Did he just thrust his hips?
         “Smeargle, are you—”
         “No! No I’m not! Not anymore…” The Normal-type respires a whistling breath. “I’ll… mellow myself down now. I’ll try not to move much. Stay safe. I’m going to nab myself some naptime…”
         Smeargle’s inner cave rolls about as the Pokemon makes himself comfortable. Soon enough, amidst the sound of his rushing blood, his groaning organs, and his digesting berries—you hear his snoring. Goodnight, Smeargle, you think to yourself as you begin to make yourself comfortable. You squish around his rectum, looking for the driest spot you can find. You find a “modestly” comfy patch, heated by his body warmth, and rest your back against the spongy wall. It smells to high heaven but at least it’s warm…
         It’s a long while before your eyes begin to wink. But given time, you’re seeing the Sandman, too.
         But during the long night, does anything happen?
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: After Dog Days Comes Dog Nights

choices: Forget the key, go get someone to force the door open
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
You hardly can believe what you're thinking: you're having a surprisingly pleasant night inside Smeargle's backside. Wait...if you're aware of that, then you're awake...? Did something rouse you up? You roll over, trying to find a comfortable position amidst the quivering flesh holding you. You vaguely feel weightlessness, and a voice you have never heard before:

"Up you go!"

You don't hear anything else. Even Smeargle's stomach was silent. Good, that'd help you sleep.

Hours later, you wake up for real, and this time you're aware what made you wake up: Smeargle's bellowing. "WHAT--" he shouts so loud the walls of the rectum shake. Alarmed, you look around yourself, as if at the end of Smeargle's system you'd find clues of what's going on outside. There's nothing, other than the surroundings looking somewhat dirtier, but it wasn't nothing you couldn't handle.

"What's happening?" you manage to ask before Smeargle starts thrashing wildly. You don't get to brace yourself before you bounce from one wall to the other, like a ragdoll.

Outside, Smeargle has found himself in an outrageous situation. It was dawn, and he had just woken up, only to find himself lying on his tummy in a familiar place he shouldn't be at: a wine storage. Barrels he knows are full of berry wine are strewn all over the place, and he's amidst them. The beagle's hands are tied behind his back, the rope extending to envelop his legs and feet. In front of him there's a small card, with colorful letters:

"GOTCHA!"


Smeargle stops thrashing around and informs you of his situation. You turn pale and sit down, freaking out: "Wait, you have been kidnapped?!"

"No! That's not it! This is a prank!" Smeargle spits the word with outrage. "Some 'mons in the tree think it's funny to play pranks on me, they even take turns! This must be one of those pranks" he tests the ropes. Those on his legs are tight, but those on his arms seem to be meant for him to get free with some effort. "Whoever thought this one up has gone too far! I'll give them a piece of my mind!"

It seemed Smeargle was in quite the pickle, indeed. You crawled on your hands and knees towards the dog's anus. "Let me out, maybe I can help." Smeargle tried, but given the way he was tied, he was unable to -- his back was curved, he couldn't strain enough to open his backdoor enough for you. You saw his sphincter twitch and move, you could tell the dog had tried his best to let you out. "...okay, that's fine. I can wait. You just focus on getting yourself untied" you say, kneeling down onto the floor and bracing yourself for what was to come. As you expected, Smeargle continued his attempts to untie himself, twisting and rolling and trying hard to snap or undo the knots.

The next hour was hell. You slid all over the place, gathering more slime on yourself, so much you were sure you were leaving the walls of the rectum spotless with your movements. All you could do was curl and be thrown around like a shoe in a washing machine, every movement dazing you and making you wish you were unconscious, but the walls -- soft and of a dark red color -- were too bouncy to do you that favor. You were at the mercy of inertia, Smeargle unwittingly condemning you to a whirlwind of movement you couldn't get out of.

At some point Smeargle had to rest, chance you used to take a deep breath and try to snap out of your dizziness. Only then you noticed that during the last hour something had progressively changed. The air inside Smeargle's large intestine never was fresh and nice, but it used to have the beagle's scent. That comforting touch was gone, replaced by something acrid and noxious. You sniffed the air, having a bad feeling of what it was. Investigating, you stood up and ran into Smeargle's colon, turning the corner until you face the source of the smell.

"...Smeargle, I think your dinner from last night is getting too close for comfort!"

"Wait, do you mean there's a bunch of..." you confirmed it. The large clumps of waste being pushed by peristalsis were unmistakable. You had just enough time to make your way back into the rectum before Smeargle restarted his efforts once again, with renewed vigor.

-------

It was a lot like deja vu.

Another hour had passed, and this one was worse since you knew there was a time limit -- for you. You had made a herculean effort to stay in the rectum despite Smeargle's movements, and during the moments of respite you evaluated the situation. Smeargle's unforgiving digestive system had turned food into a lot of crap that was starting to peek its way around the corner, slowly getting ready to pass into the rectum. The putrid smell emanating from the logs of dog shit was a nightmare -- it was hard to believe the otherwise clean beagle could produce something so foul! And the farts that came along with it didn't help at all, either. The rectum was your personal trial now.

"I'm...almost done!" Smeargle had said not long ago. Minute after minute, the waste kept approaching. You held yourself right against the backdoor, hoping that just like it had happened with Stoutland, something would happen that'd spare you from what was coming. The situation was just so similar, surely something would happen!

Only when the crap was two of your arms' distance away from you, you realized such a miracle wouldn't occur.

You decided to do what you could to avoid the unpleasant situation from turning any worse. If you stayed where you were now, the dog shit would mash you against the tailhole, its weight pressing you mercilessly. To avoid that, you crawled forward, making your body as flat as possible, and wedged yourself between the logs and the rectum walls. Slowly, you dug your fingertips into the tissue and propelled yourself forward. You could feel the surprisingly solid waste scrapping against your back -- thankfully nothing was sticking to you. Small mercies.

Your idea was simple: since you were doomed to witness how Smeargle's bowel movements were like, you didn't want to be on the front and suffer everything else falling on you. You'd try to let as much of that go out before you.

The walls compressed, forcing you to be sandwiched between unrelenting tissue and stinking refuse. "Speck, that better be you trying to get out"

"It's not!"

Outside, Smeargle's eyes widened, his ears folded against his head. He was feeling the call of nature, loud and clear. For a moment he felt his heart sinking into a deep pit of embarrassment. There were some things that should be private, and pooping seemed like it should be one of them! The thought of having to do that while the human was right there...it was mortifying. The embarrassment twisted into ire. Whoever thought this sick joke was funny would have to do a lot to compensate him for this!

Inside, you had just lodged yourself into a fold of the colon, your feet and the front of your body touching the log of waste in front of you. You shared Smeargle's annoyance. If it wasn't for this prank, you wouldn't currently be sharing your space with your newly-gained friend's refuse! Simmering in your own anger, you looked up. You hadn't managed to be the last in the queue. Looking down, you saw the unfathomably long column of shit extending down and out of sight, filling the rectum from wall to wall. There was nothing else you could do now.

------

Only fifteen minutes later Smeargle got his arms free from the rope. He immediately got them out and worked on the knots holding his legs, undoing them in no time. He was finally free, fact he informed the human about. "Alright, then please get me out of here!"

"I'm not going to take a dump at any random corner--" he had been saying, with a paw on the doorknob to open it so he could go down to his home. Clack clack. His blood ran so cold you were sure you could feel the squirming walls behind you turn into ice. "No way! The door is locked!" The prankster had done that, no doubt.

"By now Stoutland must have noticed you're late for work!"

"Of course he has! But he can't leave the entrance unguarded. He's not going to look for me until late at night!" and Smeargle certainly didn't want to spend an entire day in the wine storage. Once again the beagle felt the urge to relieve himself -- a reminder his roommate was in there too. "It's all up to you, speck"

"What do you mean?"

"Nobody ever comes here, so after you're out of me, crawl under the door and go search for the key. When you find it bring it back to me" Breaking the door down wasn't an option, he had made sure the door was the sturdiest they could get. Getting the key was the only way to open it.

You sighed, already knowing this would be a long ordeal for you. "Alright, but first can you get me out of your body?"

"I know, I know!" he said, but you didn't feel him move at all. He was completely still.

Losing some of your patience, you yell: "What are you waiting for?!"

"It's so awkward to have you watching me take a shit!"

Oh, great. He was self-conscious about that. You hoped that wouldn't be a problem. "Smeargle, I'm not in front of you. I'm inside you with the shit"

"I'm aware!" he shouted. You felt bad about how embarrassed he must be feeling. Smeargle was moving now, trying to get as far away as possible from all the wine barrels. In the meantime, you pondered your new ordeal:

Where would that key be? Taking it to the wine storage was going to be easy, the hard part was finding it. It couldn't be in the storage. There were two possibilities, you thought: either it was hidden near the storage, or the prankster had it with them.

You had to decide what your course of action would be. While you waited for Smeargle to start voiding his bowels, you took your decision.
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: Pranked

1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
The bump and bounce of Smeargle’s hurried pace rock your septic-scented imprisonment. The thump of his footsteps shudders a shockwave up the winding passage of his bowels, causing them to flutter—imprinting you with an intimately-close encounter with his still-warm dung. Smeargle’s colon reels away, recoiling as if even it is disgusted by its current occupants. You’re left stunned. Touching that thing almost disintegrated you. It was solid, but mushy. A horrible, horrible thing that threatens to consume you if Smeargle clenched too tight. If Smeargle’s waste ever manages to swallow you, dragging you to its revolting depths, you would have waking nightmares for the rest of your tiny life.
          Smeargle’s plodding stops. His innards stand stock still. His gut gurgles above.
          “Alright…” he says, his voice vibrating through the squalid walls and filthy flesh. He coughs, momentarily pinning you against his waste. “This… is as good a place as any.”
          A powerful ripple travels up from the belly of his bowels, hugging his scat as the ripple flows through the length of his intestines. You kick against the log of shit in front of you, plastering your body against his heated flesh—trying very hard to not press against browned, stained remnants of digested berry. The peristalsis of the intestines pushes the crap forward, your feet dragging a groove through its reeking outer rind. A dim light comes from the right as Smeargle’s waste peeks through his tailhole. You almost try to squeeze out with it, but one look to the left shows you the massive length of Smeargle’s crap, snaking through his bowels. You quickly decide you’d rather be the last coming out rather than have all that on top of you.
          Another crushing round of peristalsis smears you between dog crap and scummy walls. The detestable garbage-dump of waste slides forward. As it slowly passes you endure the repeated clench-and-release of Smeargle’s colon. Every clench grants you new insight of your roommate’s past meals. The forbidden knowledge burns your nose and turns you green. It’s sickening stench worms its way into your nostrils—fouler than anything you’ve ever experienced. It even beats your stay in both Honchkrow and Stoutland’s ass. There it was simply unclean: horrid tunnels furnished with slime and reeking of shit that was long since voided. But here, it is fresh. The pungent odor that made you gag in Stoutland’s colon is dialed up to eleven. It’s technically a different smell, differing diets and all, but—to you—it didn’t matter. Its ungodly, sickening stench punches you in the gut every time you take a breath. It’s a cruel bully that continues to beat you up, even after you’ve thrown in the towel.
          You’re pressed up against it again. It’s revolting surface grazes your belly. You can’t even put into words how sickly this makes you feel.

          Outside, Smeargle grunts. A cherry-red blush warms his face. He nestled himself in a dusty old corner of the wine cellar. Right next to him is a wooden wine shelf carved from the bark of the tree up above. The wine cellar was chipped from the stone and soil that was nestled between the roots of the great oak. Smeargle, trying to distract himself from the embarrassing task at hand, started reading the labels of the fermented-berry wine.
          Veno Volo, Cherubi Cherry, Early Mountain Roserade...
          Smeargle feels a tickle near his tailhole: your struggles. He looks back. His breath catches when he notices the dreadfully-long log hanging from his derriere.
          Sweet Appletun, Bayleef Creek...
          Smeargle bears down, crunching his guts. His tailhole closes. The stool clips off and plunks to the ground. He lets out a little whimper when he still feels the ring-a-ding of nature’s call.
          Château Le Budew, Straight From Servine...
          A new head of an old meal makes a reappearance, inching from his hole like a belly-child emerging into the world. Smeargle shuts his eyes tight in hot embarrassment. Even with his eyes closed, he could see his tiny Speck: squashed by his freshly shit-stained walls and pinned against—
          Smeargle snaps his eyes open. He can’t think about that! Distraction! Dis-trac-tion!
          Gossifleur Pinot Noir...


          You’re afraid that Smeargle’s bowel movement is like a World Serpent: a never ending snake that would slither past forever. A tiny easement sets upon when look over and see that rounded end of the mud-colored monstrosity. A few more rippling clenches—and it’s gone. You watch, sullied and slathered in dreck, as the tip of the thing is ejected with a sickening sllleecch. Checking twice to make sure you’re that only resident in this corner of the beagle’s behind, you pick yourself up and hurriedly tromp over to gatekeeper’s exit.
          You pound your palms on the puckered flesh, which reactively tighten as Smeargle stiffens up. You’re nearly knocked on your butt. You don’t care. You just try to part the unclean thing, still stained by fresh crap.
          And when you do, you throw yourself through. Smeargle’s paws mericully break your fall as you land in his pillow-soft fur. He swings you to his face. His sensitive nose wrinkles as he flinches in disgust.
          “Withering worlds! Oh no!” He looks at you in abject horror. “H-hold on!” He sets you down on the wooden wine shelf. He then snatches an unopened bottle, pops the cork, and gives you an impromptu wine bath.
          In the end, it leaves you smelling like the insides of a Shuckle: fruity and tooty. The strong scent of fermented berry masks the… other scents you’ve accumulated.
          “...Are you okay?” Smeargle asks at last, staring at you with tiny pupils and wide eyes.
          “...” Your look tells Smeargle all he needs to know. “I am so going to go find that asshole!” You growl.

          You scamper under the doorway and sneak through the passage of the underground, the area beneath the oak’s trunk. The hallways are carved from its hollow roots. There appears to be no one around. Seems this isn’t a place most Pokemon are allowed to be.
          Just then, as you’re turning a bend in the winding roots, you hear buttoned up snickering.
          “Heheh…” the mysterious somebody laughs. “How long you think he’s gonna be stuck in there?”
          “‘Dunno!” Another voice chimes. “But you heard him, right? Couldn’t understand a word he said, but damn! He sounded like he got his soul sucked out!”
          “You think there’s a Haunter in there?”
          “Nah! I’ve been in there a bunch of times! The wine they sell up at the surface is nasty. They hoard all the good stuff in there. Down here, it’s free if you can nab it!
          You sidle around the corner, poking your head out. Resting against the tree root wall is…
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: Getting Kicked Out the Doghouse

choices: Stealth. Search for the key and take it without getting noticed
Cajole. Try to convince Munchlax to give you the key
Threaten. Force Munchlax to give you the key
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
You hid again behind the corner, having taken a look at who you had to deal with. There are two Pokemon, one small and the other large. You recognize the species at a glance. The small one is a Purrloin, the purple cat is distinctive. The other one, though...that's a Munchlax. What surprises you, though, is its size. Munchlax aren't known for being a large species, yet this one seemed to be halfway towards having a Snorlax's size. It was impressive in its own right!

The talk of wine gets Munchlax to hum appreciatively. "I'd love to have some wine right now..."

"It's precisely because of 'mons like you that they lock it so well. You'd drink everything in there in thirty minutes" the Purrloin said. Her smile extended all over her face, clearly she was having a lot of fun. "But after this I'm getting you a bottle, you deserve it. This should make Smeargle lighten up a little!"

Munchlax laughed. "No problem...glad to help." Their conversation continued. From what you understood, Purrloin and Munchlax were a bit of a team, Purrloin being the one to scheme while Munchlax carried it out -- as long as he didn't get distracted. During the conversation he often got lost in thought, and Purrloin had to bring his mind back into what they were talking about.

"At this rate Smeargle is going to stay there the entire day! Can you imagine how angry he'll be if that happens? I bet he'll be so angry his fur will turn red" Purrloin said. You felt a surge of anger, but you didn't go confront them. Smeargle and you got off the wrong foot, but you certainly would have never thought about locking him somewhere! It was a nasty prank, that was what it was.

Munchlax scratched his head. "Heheh...but you know...if he misses the entire day and he finds out we locked him, he'll kick us out of the tree"

"Relax, at sunset we'll pass the key under the door and get away from here. He'll never know it was us" you took the quiet decision to inform Smeargle when you were taking to him the key yourself. Sunset was still so far away!

"Isn't that too long? I'm not sure I like that..."

"Ugh, you always get cold feet. Fine. If you're so scared about it then we'll give the key at noon. Happy now?" Munchlax nodded sleepily, eyes closed. Although he had cooperated in this, he seemed far less passionate than Purrloin was.

"That's better" Munchlax yawned widely. "Now we won't have to wait for so long...doing nothing while we wait is boring"

"I told you to bring something to keep yourself busy with!"

"I forgot" he tilted his head, eyes closed. "I'm sorry, Purrloin. My bad"

Purrloin puffed her cheeks. "You always forget something! And here I had thought we had finally done something without you screwing up" she shrugged. "Well as far as mistakes go, this isn't that big of a problem. I'll see what I can find at your home"

"Thanks, Purrloin. Do you think Smeargle has untied himself already?"

"Probably, but he can't leave the storage anyway. You can wait for me here until I return." Purrloin's tail swished. Thanks to the movement, you noticed something you hadn't seen before: the key had been hooked on the end of her tail. Taking the key, she extended it towards Munchlax. "If anyone sees me with the key they'll ask questions, so you keep it until I'm back. Got it?"

"Sure" Munchlax took the key, turning it around in his hands.

"You better not lose it! If we lose that key we're in deep trouble"

Munchlax tucked the key in his fur. You remembered hearing before that Munchlax tended to hide food and stuff in their fur, it made sense it'd be hidden in there. That was going to be a problem -- although now you knew where the key was, that fur was a daunting obstacle. From where you were standing you could see how long and shaggy that fur was. You were pretty sure if you were in middle of it the fur would tower far above you! How could a Pokemon have so much fur?

Purrloin didn't seem to be convinced about what he did. "Are you sure you can just stick it in there and you won't lose it?" Munchlax didn't reply, just staring at her with dopey expression. Purrloin reconsidered: "Then again, by now I think a quarter of your weight is from stuff you have there...fine. But you better not move!"

"No? I wanted to check on Smeargle..."

"No, don't move from here! If you move you may lose the key. I'm not taking any risks!" her tone left no room for discussion. Munchlax sighed.

"Fine...I'll stay here and just stare at the roots of the tree..."

"Good, that's what I wanted to hear. See? Everything goes well when you listen to me" Purrloin winked. "I'll be back with something for you!" and without looking back, Purrloin hurried away, intending to bring something for Munchlax to entertain himself with until it was time to give Smeargle the key and run away.

This was your chance, you thought. There was absolutely no possibility you could reason with Purrloin -- you understood she had been the one to plan this whole thing, and judging by how joyful she had sounded while she mocked Smeargle, it was very unlikely you'd get her to change her mind.

Munchlax, though...perhaps you could do something there? He was coasting along with Purrloin's ideas, a lackey of sorts. He may not be as invested as Purrloin is in. While he did seem willing enough to play pranks on Smeargle, you thought there was a chance he'd have pity on him.

Also, he had the key somewhere in his fur. That was the most important factor.

Slowly and carefully, you turned the corner, intending to come closer. Munchlax yawned again and sat down, reclining onto the wall and crossing his hands over his chest, staring at the empty air with contemplative expression. "We're not getting caught, right...? We won't get kicked out...right?" he says to the emptiness. Nothing replies. "I hope she will give me some wine later...that should make this worth it"

As if a bottle of wine would be worth what you went through!

You're getting closer and closer to Munchlax's sitting form. It likely wasn't going to be long before Purrloin returned, so you had to hurry. By now you have already decided what approach you will take.
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: Prankster and Sidekick

choices: A rush of adrenaline gives you the strength to hold. You’re still in this!
Your arms give. You dribble down Munchlax’s belly. And below his belly is, well…
Light bursts in as Munchlax’s fur parts. It seems he’s remembered that poffin...
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
Stealth. It’s the only option. Well, the only option you think that’ll work. Trying to persuade Munchlax to give you the key could easily end in disaster, especially if Purrloin returns mid-conversation. Oh boy. You shudder, thinking about devilish “pranks” she’d brew for you…
          And threatening him? At this size? You’d be punching way above your weight class. Even if Purrloin’s lackey is weak willed, there’s still a significant chance you’d end up with an upset Munchlax.
          You swing around the corner, creeping up against the wall. Your feet make the faintest of thuds against the hardwood floor, but the sound dies long before it reaches Munchlax’s ears. The giant Pokemon stares blankly into space, eyes half closed. Daydreaming about booze? Probably. His paws hang by his side, draped slack against his pelt. They’re too high for you to reach. But as you get closer, you’re relieved to find that there’s no shortage of hand-holds on the Pokemon’s body.
          You’re right under his massive paws. You stand beside the tuft of his coat. His slate-blue fur rolls from his body like an unfurled carpet, draping onto the floor like a too-long curtain. You step onto the tips of his hairs. Munchlax does not stir.
          The key is under his fur… You softly click your tongue, thinking. Climbing the outside of his fur isn’t going to do much. I won’t have a clue where it is…
          You nose your way past Munchlax’s shroud of fur. Your hands part his wooly coat as if you’re performing an open-air breaststroke. His fur parts to reveal a second layer of curly hair. You let the first coat close behind you, draping you in darkness. The outside air left behind, the scent of wild Munchlax grows strong. It’s not horribly unpleasant. It smells exactly like what you’d expect if you buried your nose in the fur of a wild Pokemon.
          But you also catch a whiff of something strange. Smothered by Munchlax’s scent, is a grab bag of odors. A metallic tang, a fragrant sweetness, a spicy prickliness. You’ve been hit by a Dizzy Punch of aromas. Is it all from the stuff Munchlax has hidden underneath his fur?
         You brush past Munchlax’s second coat. For a long moment, you stumble in near darkness. Underneath, your hands tickle his undercoat—his final layer of hair. While not as shaggy as the fur that’s tickling you from above, his undercoat still soars above. Each and every hair is larger than you. The good news: you’re sure they’ll support your weight. You grab a fistful of hair and pull yourself upwards. Your upper arm strains as your muscles tremble. After you successfully lift off the ground, your arms and feet gripping Munchlax’s hair like a thickly-spun rope. Goodness! This is going to be harder than you thought…
         You clamber up your hair-rope like you’re Jack and the Beanstalk. Grunting and muttering as you scale the blue-furred mountain, you whisper a prayer that the Pokemon’s hair muffles your words—hiding them from Munchlax’s pointy ears. As you scramble on upwards, hair drapes over you like a jungle canopy. Higher, higher, and higher you go. When one hair ends, you leap to another. Hopping from hair to hair leaves you exhausted. But you feel like you’re making progress! If you have to give a wild guess, you’d wager you’re crawling somewhere around Munchlax’s belly.
         That sweet smell from earlier? It gets stronger. You’re too tired to care though. You single-mindedly continue to climb, stopping only when your hands clasp onto something sticky.
         “Wh-what?” While you struggle to pry your hands free, you stretch your head up. You see a pink-frosted Poffin—a luxury baked good for pampered Pokemon. Most curiously, it is slathered in golden, dripping honey. You can’t help but wonder, did someone give this to Munchlax? Did Purrloin steal it? How long has it been sitting here!?
         You’re tired muscles sob as you strain to free your sticky hands. No dice. Looking back at the sweet treat, you see a new dribbling of honey begin to sluck off the poffin—heading towards you. A swear shoots between your clenched teeth as you just manage to unstick-ify yourself. But before you can scramble to another hair, that glob of sickly sweetness plunges down—dumping itself onto you.
         The weight of the heavy liquid is enormous. And the weight threatens to strip you off the strand of fur and send you oozing down the Munchlax’s belly. You try everything in your power to hold on, but is it enough? Does an outside force swing by and add another snarl in the already chaotic mix?
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: A Fur-tive Climb

choices: You reach the tip. Getting inside is your only option!
Munchlax feels your struggles. He checks what's going on!
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
Before this moment you had never thought of honey as heavy. Right now, with just a dollop of it flowing over you, at your current size, it feels like someone is trying to put an entire world on your shoulders. The liquid is surprisingly heavy, you feel like it's going to stick on you forever. Despite that, you close your eyes cling to the hair you're on as strongly as possible.

Perhaps you would have managed to cling successfully if the hair hadn't started to bend too. It bends under the weight of the honey, forming a curve. I can't let it happen...not when I have gotten this far! You had climbed a lot, you couldn't let the honey drag you all the way to the floor!

The honey had gotten between your fingers. That was what at first made you not notice you had been carried down. It's when you feel yourself moving down that you realize you're currently traveling down Munchlax's belly. You open your eyes, seeing a lot of teal fur pass by, the honey parting the way like Moses. Strands of hair you could stand on breeze by, the honey passing around and between them you think there's nothing that could stop your descent.

Thankfully, you're proven wrong. The drop of honey you're on settles on something. You pull yourself free from the honey, taking advantage of the respite, while the honey starts to bifurcate, trying to get past the obstacle that got in its way. You manage to unstick yourself right when it continued flowing. You're safe! But where had you stopped at. You look around at your surroundings.

Way above you the dome of Munchlax's other two layers of hair, and underneath you there's something covered with short hairs. Seems like something jutting out from Munchlax's undercoat, some sort of cylinder. It takes you some thinking to realize where you have been forcibly taken to: you're currently standing on Munchlax's genitals. Part of the reason why it took you a moment to realize that is that the fog of scents all over you masked the smell of musk that would otherwise coat the area.

For a moment you freak out, not liking it at all. This wasn't part of the plan to find the key! You really doubted it would be anywhere on Munchlax's sheath! You take a moment to calm down and evaluate the situation. The skin and fur in front of you is still full of honey, you wouldn't be able to climb it. To your sides there's the circumference of the Pokemon's sheath, extending a dozen meters to the sides. Approaching one of the edges, you look. There's quite the long drop going down, so far you can only see fur and more fur going down. You're not getting down.

The realization hits you: you're stranded. The only option you can think right now is wait for the honey to dry up.

Barely two minutes have passed when you hear a voice you dreaded to hear, muffled behind the thick curtain of fur: Purrloin is back.

---------

Purrloin was some kind of machine, bringing it with her. "Why do you have so much junk? Are you collecting it or what?"

Munchlax, not having seen her approach, blinks blearily, recognizing what she had brought: his miniature Poffin machine. She better be careful with that! "Something like that..."

"I brought you this because it's the only thing I didn't know about. It must be interesting to you. What is it, anyway?"

"It's for...for good food. But you didn't bring me ingredients" Purrloin muttered a 'oh'. So she had dragged that thing as big as her all the way down, for nothing.

"...W-Well that's not my fault. I dunno about this kinda thing! Let's go to what's important: do you still have the key?"

Munchlax scratches his chest, tilting his head. "I think so?"

"You think? You didn't move, did you?!"

"Nope, I sat here all the time..." he started searching in his fur, finding a menagerie of things, most of them food. Berries, candy, interesting rocks, random items, very old and moldy bread, a bottle of hot sauce. A sweet Poffin! May as well take that. He hadn't found the key yet, but since he hadn't taken it out -- and he was sure he hadn't eaten it by accident, as far as he knew -- then it must have been somewhere in there. There was no hurry to find it, he thought, biting into the Poffin.

Purrloin didn't want to stand around and watch Munchlax eat, though. She put the Poffin machine down. "Come on, stand up! And move!" She intended to check if the key was anywhere on the ground. Obeying, Munchlax stood up, moving aside. While Purrloin checked the ground carefully, he looked wistfully at his portable Poffin machine.

"I'm putting this aside" he said, taking his machine with his hands.

"Take it with you to the wine storage. I have a plan to make Smeargle never realize we had anything to do with the prank" Since the key indeed was nowhere on the ground, she judged Munchlax still had it. "I'm really good with voices. I can make him think some strangers got into the tree and did that to him"

"Do you think that will work...?" not even Munchlax seemed convinced about that.

"Of course it will! I know what I'm doing, so let's go!" she said, getting behind Munchlax and pushing him forward. She'd walk behind him, in case he let the key fall down somewhere along the way.

-------

Munchlax standing up certainly didn't go unnoticed to you. Until now, Munchlax's dick had been level, like a platform you didn't want to think much about, but now that he had stood up, the formerly stable ground had turned into an incline, a steep 60° incline that threatened to throw you off. You laid down immediately, grabbing onto the surface of the sheath like your life depended on it.

Every step Munchlax gave rocked your world, making you feel like you were in an earthquake. Your teeth clattered, you felt like all your bones were threatened to be pulverized just from the movements.

The incline proved to be too much of a problem, though. Slowly but surely, you started sliding down the sheath. Your arms were not even close to hugging not even the top part of Munchlax's dick, much less all of it to stop you from sliding, you felt yourself go down. Looking downwards, you saw the end not too far away -- the curve of the tip of the sheath leading to nothingness.

Surviving that fall was going to be quite the challenge! And even if you did, you would be in danger of Munchlax stepping on you. Being small gave you some toughness you didn't have before, but you weren't sure you wouldn't survive something like Munchlax stepping on you!

You pressed yourself against the sheath, trying to stop your descent, just managing to slow it down somewhat. It was only matter of time before you'd be sent careening off Munchlax's dick and towards the ground. It didn't help that the surface of Munchlax's sheath was covered with short, pointy hairs. Trying to cling on it felt like you were throwing yourself on blunt needles, the sensation being almost painful.

There was one thing you had clear, though: you had to do everything in your power to not fall down!

You tried once again to slow your descent, succeeding somewhat. Your mind races, considering what could happen. Looking behind you, the tip is merely an inch away. A desperate idea crossed your mind: the tip meant there'd be a hole there. If you could get into it, that'd save your life. You weren't looking forward to getting in close quarters with Munchlax's dick resting inside the sheath, but if it saved your life...

Still, you left that as your very last option. Instead, you grasp the surface of the sheath again, praying Munchlax would stop walking anytime soon.
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: Unexpected Detour

1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
One good step, one solid stomp—and you’ll be done for. The end of your fuzzy, short-haired slide is fast approaching. Another one of Munchlax’s footsteps jostles his sheathe, quaking your Earth and sending you that much closer to a long, long fall.
          Your feet kick air. Your hips hang on the lip of the fuzzy slide. The side of your face pressed deep into the musty fur, you look to the right. You see the unmistakable shimmer of Munchlax’s undercoat as his great legs shift the hairs around—moving in for another step. If that foot crashes to the ground, you’re a goner. Unless…
          ...You take shelter.
          Thinking at light-speed, you allow yourself to slip further down. Holding on to the top of Munchlax’s sheathe by your fingertips, you come face-to-dick with the rounded opening of the Big Eater’s sheathe. It’s like the wrinkled top of a pulled bag, the type you tighten the top with strings. It’s teal; darkness and furry flesh hide the revulsive thing that lurks within.
          You don’t have much of a choice. You grab onto a hair—longer than the others. You kick off but hold on, building momentum in your swing. When it's time for you to come boomeranging back, you let go—praying your momentum is enough to send you further in.
          It is.
         The puckered opening swallows your view as you come crashing in. You’re consumed, readily. The menagerie of wild scents that mingled in Munchlax’s fur disappear. You’re punched with a musk beyond imagining. It’s a masculine scent, brimming with testosterone and spiced with the nose-wrinkling smell of sweat. The walls are yielding, but cramped. Inside, the fur coats everything like a musky carpet. Soft skin squishes at you from all sides. Your vision is blocked from wandering too far within by pressed together walls of short-haired flesh. Thank the stars above; you can’t see the pink terror that’s surely further down.
         All is good—for a moment. Munchlax’s footpaw stamps down, sending a bone-jostling rumble through his lower body. His dick flops up and down—not a big deal to Munchlax, but most certainly for you. Your legs and hips, still free, begin sliding backwards—taking you with them. You panic, scrambling in the only direction you know: deeper. Your fingers drum against the wool, dancing as they look for a handhold to pull you in. They do—and you’re very lucky Munchlax did not feel that. Your elbows bend 90 degrees as you strain your chest, hoisting you in with their microscopic muscles. You’re gobbled up to your belly button, then your waist. Soon enough, only your legs remain. You waste no time to move those in too, making it look like Munchlax’s genitals slurped your legs in like spaghetti.
         Now completely enveloped, from your head to your toes, you brush away the sweaty hairs that poke you from every which way. You’re lost in them, nearly blinded in the darkness. You grab fill your fists with fur, holding onto the musky stuff as your cylindrical constrainment bobs up and down, shuffling freely with Munchlax’s gait. Sweat pricks your brow, surprising you as you come to notice the heat. It didn’t occur to you before—but where you are now, it’s a lot like a greenhouse. You’re hidden away in a musky grotto, sealed beneath thick lard and fur. And above that, his privates broil beneath a triple-coat of husky fur. The heat worsens the smell, which was not pleasant to begin with. Now, you realize, it’s clear: Munchlax does not know proper hygiene. That much, you can smell. Unwashed, musky fur peels open your nostrils, allowing the pungent funk old seed to waltz right in. It’s sweaty, greasy, and overall unpleasant. And once your hand happens upon a suspiciously crusty section of fur—you immediately wish you took your chances with the drop.
— — —

         Purrloin’s plan goes swimmingly. She dons a goofy voice, cartoonishly evil, declaring that she—Meowth—was Smeargle’s dastardly pranker! (Who always worked alone and never had a Munchlax partner!)
         Afterwards, she waits a minute, slaps on a cute, squeaky voice, and asks if anyone is behind the wine cellar door.
         “Yes! Hello! Help!” Smeargle shouts with cupped hands, or at least you assume. “I’m locked in here! Blessed Gracideas, please tell me you have the key!”
         “Mm-hmm.” Purrloin hums, still in a false voice. “I’ll unlock it! But don’t rush out right away! I’m small—you’ll crush me!”
         “Oh dear,” Smeargle’s voice wavers through the door, “thank you!”
         Back in your musty, hairy world, you’re sweating more bullets than a SMG. The hair around you is wet; you’re drenched. Worst of all, you’re pretty dang sure most of it's not yours…
         You sense your dripping universe lift as Munchlax adjusts himself. You hear scratching ring out from below you. Yep—it’s exactly what it sounds like. Your chest deflates. You just got an intimate listening of Munchlax’s ball scratching.
         A hissed whisper somehow pierces through Munchlax’s sweltering sheathe. “Munchlax! The key!”
         “Oh.” He says. You hear the scritch-scratch of his claws digging through his fur before it stops—looks like he’s found it.
         Click and clack. The key fits perfectly. You hear a rapid-fire pattering of feet as Purrloin speeds off, faster than wind. Munchlax is left in the dust. You feel his body shift as he tilts, looking left, then right. He realizes he should be moving. He plods away at a gentle pace.
         “Hello?” Smeargle meekly says, “can I come out now? Is… the door unlocked?”
— — —

         By counting your unaware captor’s steps, you’re able to keep track of the time. It’s been about thirty minutes. It feels like it’s been thirty hours. Somehow, the mustiness of this Arceus-forsaken realm has increased. You think it’s because the stench has been wearing you down, worming into your head—simply making you more aware of the repugnance of unwashed genitals. At least, that’s what you hope. The other implications are… unpleasant.
         You wash your lungs in funk as you swallow a deep breath. Munchlax has been walking for quite some time. Where is he going? Is he meeting up with Purrloin for a rendevouz at some previously-established place? Or is he clomping back to his room—retiring early for the day?
         An abrupt halting smushes you against a moist patch of wet fur. You feel your world wobble as Munchlax tottles, kicking his legs wildly as he tries to keep his balance. A clatter crashes through the air. Munchlax falls on his butt, sending a planet-rippling shockwave right through you. Once he finds his bearings, you hear a voice—concerned.
         “Are you okay?” You have a hard time discerning the gender.
         “Uh… I think?” Munchlax fumbles.
         “I’m so sorry! You’re covered in food! I dropped the platter and—”
         “I’m fine with that.”
         “...What? No—c’mon. Follow me to my room. I’ll make it up to; clean you up, give you something special.”
         A long hum shakes the soggy earth. “Hmmm…”
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: Sleuthing in the Sheathe

choices: You manage to reach Raichu successfully
Somewhere along the way, Munchlax senses you
You don't even get to exit. Munchlax gets up and leaves
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.content:
Munchlax's response doesn't seem to have deterred the other Pokemon. }"Oh, is she? That's okay, I will bring her later"

"Really? Then I accept"

"Come in! My home is right over there, see? I was taking this tray with food to...well that doesn't matter anymore." Everything behind you jostles, you're pretty sure Munchlax is being pushed forward. You can't see a thing due to the thick curtain of fur that covers Munchlax's body, so you don't know what kind of place your current host has been pushed into, but you suppose it's similar to Smeargle's room -- if that Pokemon was telling the truth, that is.

-------

"Oh, look at you, I just made a mess all over you! Seriously, I'm so sorry"

Munchlax subtly passed a claw over the food that was splattered over his fur, tasting it. Not bad! He turned his head to glance at the Pokemon who had pretty much bathed him with a free lunch. Raichu, was it? What was it Purrloin said about this one? 'Raichu has gotten so clumsy since they evolved. It must be their feet, they turned huge'.

Better not comment about those feet. Munchlax let himself be pushed towards the couch, where he was asked to sit. Not long afterwards, Raichu returned with a towel, giving it to the Pokemon they had inconvenienced so much. "Here, you really need it"

"...I guess? I didn't really mind"

"I'm so sorry about this, I should have watched where I was walking" Raichu sat on the other end of the couch. "I promise I'm going to give you something special. Purrloin is getting something too" oh, Purrloin was getting something too? She was going to be glad to hear that. Munchlax tried again to say she was waiting for him, but Raichu once again stopped him. "Wait, let's tak a little. It's the least I can do for you! So, tell me" Raichu's lackadaisical tone changed, acquiring a seriousness that was still tinged with concern. "This Purrloin...how has she been treating you?"

-------

Something is going on, you can tell that much. Munchlax apparently couldn't, but you did.You wormed your way to the hole of the sheath, listening attentively.

"Um...my friend?"

"She treats you well, right? I have heard she's not the nicest Pokemon around"

"She is my friend. I like her and we have been friends for years" Munchlax sounded genuinely fond of her. "The other day she brought me this shiny thing she had found, and she said that was my part for...something I did. I don't even remember what it was"

"Oh. That so?" Raichu's voice hinted they were annoyed. That wasn't what Raichu had hoped to hear? You admit you were a bit surprised to hear Purrloin treated her lackey with what seemed to be friendliness. She had seemed a little too rough to do that.

"Yep. You bringing her? You said you're giving us something special"

"...I said that, didn't I" you heard noises outside. While Raichu rummaged somewhere else, they kept asking: "Are you sure there's nothing you want to tell me about her? I have heard she has been stealing stuff around in the tree and other places. Have you helped her?"

"Sure. Why wouldn't I?"

"Because...thievery is kinda bad" Raichu mumbled. In that moment you had the nagging suspicion the whole thing about hitting Munchlax with food was a ploy to get him into this room, and talk to him about Purrloin. Perhaps Raichu had expected something different? Like a reason for Munchlax to tattle about many, many crimes Purrloin had done?

If Smeargle disliked criminals so much then he really managed to screw up when Purrloin was accepted as a resident in the tree. You hoped she got there before the beagle had his current job as head of security.

"But I guess you don't really want to talk about her...that's fine. I will give you something nice and special for your time" they sounded so disappointed. "Here. This is kinda my specialty"

"All that? For me?" you could practically hear the tears of joy in Munchlax's eyes. Whatever meal Raichu had just offered must be really worthwhile!

"Of course. I just ask that if you remember anything you tell me. I really want to know more about her"

Whatever Raichu had in mind must be rather important. You take a decision rather quickly:

Since you're so aware of Purrloin's devilry, you could give Raichu the information they wanted. If what they wanted was someone to tell them about what that cat had done, you were more than willing to speak! Just today she had done enough to warrant some justice, in your opinion! And you were sure there had to be more in the past.

The problem was reaching Raichu. You doubted you had much time to do it, just until Munchlax was done eating whatever food Raichu had just given him. You peered outside of the sheath. Since Munchlax was sitting down, you judged there was a good chance you'd be able to descend without being in mortal danger.

If you could get out, sneak through Munchlax's fur, and get on the couch, you could let Munchlax leave and then you'd have a nice talk with Raichu. They seemed to be nice enough, although a little deceitful, judging by how they had lured Munchlax in this room with a scheme. You had no reason to believe you'd be treated badly.

The fact you were in a hurry to leave your current filthy transport was another factor, you had to admit. You were willing to take your chances by descending now!

Having taken a decision, you start getting out of the sheath, intending to descend and talk to Raichu.
1141111212121121132221212112222222321111.title: “...sorry…Purrloin is waiting for me…”

11411112121211211322212121123.content:
The next hour passed by incredibly slowly. Just like he said he would, Nidoking settled on the floor, curling and starting to snore so loudly you idly wondered if you'd be able to sleep. You wouldn't, regardless. The guilt was gnawing at you.

At the time telling Nidoking was your only choice. You knew that very well, but if you had the chance to turn back time and be on that exact moment again you wouldn't have mentioned Honchkrow. Chances are you would have instead chosen Noibat. Unlike Honchkrow, Noibat had absolutely no redeeming qualities you could recall in the brief time you knew it. On the other hand, Honchkrow had shown concern for you and not a hint of aggression at first. You had believed his friendliness and, even after having offended you greatly, he tried to appease you by going back all the way to where you met, all to pick up a fork that would be useless to you anyway. That was meant to be a sign of apology, wasn't it? You peered at the fork lying to a side, forgotten. Maybe he took so long to return because finding it was difficult. You wonder if he had thought he couldn't return without it because you wouldn't forgive him. Quite presumptuous of him to believe a fork would be enough to solve the ill will you had towards him.

Now Honchkrow was on the verge of death, and you were pretty much complicit for it. Despite how upset you were, you really had hoped Nidoking wouldn't go this far.

The bunch of cloth that was your bed right now seemed oppressive to you right now, so you got off and walked around, trying to clear your mind. Nidoking continued sleeping, oblivious to your turmoil, and there were no other noises in the entire manor. It was like you had the entire place to yourself. You were sure you'd have to stay in this place for quite some time, given your size and the hostility of the world outside. The thought of being in the vicinity of Nidoking after this was disquieting, even though you knew Nidoking had nothing against you, but it was freaking you out nonetheless. You approached the slumbering Nidoking, until you were so close you could place a hand on his leathery purple hide on his bacj.

Somewhere underneath that hide was Honchkrow. You kept remembering vividly the moment he disappeared inside that formidable, humongous body. The purple skin...although different in color, it was close enough to the Noibat that had eaten you not that long ago. That Noibat had forsaken you to the same fate Honchkrow was suffering now, a horrible death inside a stomach. Back then you would have been very grateful for someone helping you.

Honchkrow would be grateful now. Frowning, you walked around him. THe trek took you quite the considerable amount of time, until you were facing his belly. There was absolutely no hint of Honchkrow. Not surprising, given Nidoking was extraordinarily large. Somewhere beneath that hide the bird was...was he still alive? You approached, until you placed your ear against the belly. Nidoking was fast asleep and seemed to be a heavy sleeper, and even if he wasn't, you doubted someone of your size could ever wake him up. Closing your eyes, you listened.

At first all you hear are gurgles. When you were about to give up, you hear something else, a faint shuffling of feathers. That had to be him! "Honchkrow?" you said aloud. Would your voice even get through the thick skin?

Apparently it did. "Help me!" Not even a greeting, he went straight to the help request. Things must be getting rather rough in there. "I don't want to die, you have to help me!"

"I didn't want you to die, I just..." things had just gotten out of control, that was all.

"I'm sorry, I'm really sorry, I-I just wanted to help, I swear I was just trying to help!"

"What about your...your..." you felt so disgusted you couldn't even mention it.

"Look, that was an accident, I'm sorry, I didn't want to use you as a toy! I really, really wanted to help you!" he pleaded. You were sure he was crying his eyes out. "You can't-You can't leave me here!"

He was right. You couldn't. Not if you wanted to be able to ever sleep again. "Do you think you can resist for a while longer?"

"Everything feels itchy in here!" That couldn't be a good sign. It would be matter of hours before the bird would get digested. Stepping back, you consider the situation. Nidoking was incredibly large, so much his insides would be monumentally roomy for you. The problem was that you didn't know what you could do. Entering Nidoking would be very easy, doing anything of use would be the difficult part, given your size.

On the other hand, Honchkrow was in a slightly more favorable position to escape. You had managed to do that when you were in a stomach, but you were much smaller than Honchkrow, and had a more level-head than the bird did. You were sure that, without help, Honchkrow would perish. Maybe you could give him instructions so he would attempt a escape by himself.

Both were much easier said than done, you realized. You...
11411112121211211322212121123.title: There must be a way to save the oaf! Honchkrow ...

choices: ...and pleads to keep this whole incident a secret.
...and asks if you can do him a favor.
114111121212112113222121211232.content:
You wrack through your brains, creating and discarding half-thought-out plans at light speed. With a furrowed brow and a hand placed lightly on the surface of the Nidoking’s midsection, you concentrate on the king’s belly. You swear if your gaze was anymore intense, you could bore a hole right through the Pokemon’s armored gut.
         An ominous gurgle reminds you that your time is limited.
         “Th-thought of anything yet?” Honchkrow asks with creeping desperation.
         “...No. Not yet.”
         You watch as Nidoking’s stomach cyclically puffs in and out as he snores the night away. The sloshing of a thick liquid and the muted complaints of a bird within sound out every time his belly inflates.
         “Honchkrow,” you ask, “how much room do you have in there? Can you shuffle and shift and make him sick?” You hear half-hearted slorshing as tired Honchkrow slops about.
         “My beautiful feathers…” Honchkrow caws, voice cracking, “they’re all covered in yuck. I can barely lift my wings….” You hear a splatter as Honchkrow splashes in marshy swamp-like remnants of giant Pokemon’s previous meals. “It stinks in here!”
         Honchkrow crows and cries at such a cacophonous volume, you wince and pray that his squawking doesn’t reach Nidoking’s ears.
         “It smells like puke! It smells like a Trubbish died inside of a Garbodor that died inside of an even larger Garbodor and... I-I’m inside of it for some reason! It feels like I’m wading through old cereal! I’m swimming in the world’s grossest birdba—Eyuch! It’s in my beak! It’s in my beak! I—” Nidoking’s snoring abruptly stops. His ears flicker. His stomach squeezes in like a crumpling soda can.
         “Learn to put a sock in it, bird!” Nidoking sharply grumbles. You quickly pull your hand away. Thank Arceus he’s blind. He didn’t notice you.
         “H-help!” Honchkrow’s gurgly plea sounds like he’s shouting from the bottom of a bowl of porridge. Nidoking snarls.
         “I don’t like my food waking me up. Enjoy drowning.” Nidoking lets out a rumbling groan as he compresses his stomach even more. His belly quivers as his muscles strain to hold their crushing embrace. Your heart beats like a frenzied drum and your stomach goes into free-fall as you watch in horror.
         “Stop!” the crow yells through the sludge within the Poison-type’s innards. “Can’t breathe! I can’t—”
         Suddenly, Nidoking sports the strangest face.
         “My foot! My foot!” Honchkrow bleats. “It’s got my foot!” Nidoking gasps as his stomach involuntarily caves in, squeezing and dousing his internal captive in its contents. The muscle mindlessly continues to crush. “It’s got both my legs! It’s trying to drag me down!” Nidoking and his gut groan in tandem as his stomach rhythmically contracts in peristalsis.
         “I’m sinking! Little One, he-ee-elp!” Nidoking gasps as his belly gives one final groaning push before bouncing back, slackening to its regular state — grumbling satisfactorily.
         For once, Honchkrow is silent.
         Where’s Honchkrow? Is he dead? Alive? Drowning? Not drowning? These questions and a million more swim through your mind before Nidoking answers them all for you.
         “It’s... deeper?” Nidoking bellows in a voice like a surprised mountain. You have no idea what to make of his words before it hits you.
         Honchkrow is deeper.
         In Nidoking.
         ...Like you in Noibat.
         That poor, poor crow.
         Nidoking looks and shouts directly toward his abdomen, “g-get out of there you idiot!” He takes one of his great claws and smacks his lower belly.
         “Mmm-mmph!” a muffled complaint rises from beneath the scales.
         Honchkrow doesn’t even have enough room to open his beak... You think wordlessly to yourself. It must be really tight in there.
         “If you don’t get out of there,” Nidoking threatens with an anxiety and unsureness you’ve not heard him express before, “I’ll… I’ll… do some sit-ups?”
         “MMPH! MMPH!”
         Well, at least there’s no doubt that he’s alive….
         “This is absolutely bizarre…” Nidoking says to no one in particular.
         “...How am I even going to get you out of there!?” The beast roars to the bird below his belly. After letting his words echo for a moment, he breathes a heavy sigh. “This is… humiliating. Nobody can know of this.” That’s when you got a bright idea. You cup your hands around your face and holler...
         “Hey Nidoking!”
         You never could’ve imagined a Nidoking could make such a funny face.
         “How’s it doing?” you mockingly emphasize the “it,” poking fun at the Nidoking’s nickname for his fantastic voyager.
         “You… you’re awake?” Nidoking asks sheepishly. A claw anxiously sidles down and hovers above Honchkrow’s approximate location, as if that could do anything to hide what you’ve witnessed.
         “Where are you? You...didn't see all that, did you?” Nidoking asks with a flushed face as he plants a claw on the floor and begins to stand…
114111121212112113222121211232.title: The Crow Goes With the Flow

choices: You change your mind about the entrance method
1141111212121121132221212112323.content:
Nidoking shakily stands up. From your vantage position you can clearly see he's freaking out. You never thought you'd see the king on the verge of a panic attack that most likely would be violent. Nidoking shuffles away from you, dragging his feet, and closes all the doors of the room, making sure nobody could open them from the outside. After that, he slams his head against one of them, grumbling:

"You cannot tell anyone about what you saw"

"Really? That's all you have to say?" you said caustically, your voice almost as venomous as Nidoking's poison. He turns his head around, his blind eyes pointing in your direction.

"Look, this is not good. Not only the rest cannot find out about this for obvious reasons, I cannot keep that birdbrain inside my gut where he is. Don't you get it? If he gets stuck for too long, we both die. I have lived for a very long time, the last thing I need is to die because some idiot got lodged in my intestines!"

You'd say that would be quite the karmic death, but you refrain from commenting that. "Can't your body, you know, push him along?"

"He's too big! It would take ages, and I already told you he could get stuck!" he places a claw again on his lower body. "I can feel him moving very slowly. We'll have to hurry things up, and you will help me"

"What? What exactly are you asking me to do?" you asked with some trepidation. Nidoking hurried to a shelf rather high in the air and passed a claw over it, taking all the contents in his hand. You hadn't seen before what was up there, so when he approaches and tosses everything in front of you, you take a good look at the very bizarre objects. They were bizarre not because they were strange, they were bizarre because of their size. They were tiny objects. Industrial clothing, a gas mask, a helmet with a light, a pickaxe, several other mining tools, rope, other assorted resistant clothing that was frayed and corroded. You weren't sure what to ask other than: "What's this?"

"A long time ago, back when I hadn't evolved not even once yet, there was a human in this area. A miner, I believe. They and their stuff were shrunk for a reason I don't remember and they lived around until their untimely death. Among their stuff there was this electric rod, I want you to take it"

You couldn't believe it. Someone had gone through your same situation before! And...apparently they had died. That sure didn't make you feel any better. Still, this was something you needed to remember. You pick up the tool you were indicated. "Now what?"

What followed was better than you expected. Nidoking laid on the floor and placed you on his belly, indicating a spot amidst the armored stomach. You walked to that point and pressed the point of the tool against the tough hide. Nidoking had said they'd need to stimulate his guts so they would push Honchkrow along, so you obeyed and pressed the button to send an electric zap through it.

Nothing happened. You tried again and again, all the sparks emerging and disappearing almost instantly. It didn't take you long to realize what was going on: Nidoking was part Ground-type! Of course this wasn't going to work on his skin. You inform Nidoking of that. "No, no, no! This is unacceptable!"

"This isn't my fault!"

"I know, I just..." the king had the good grace not to move suddenly. "Alright. I didn't want to ask you this, but these are desperate times. I want you to go inside of me and do it from the inside. That should work"

There it was. The request you were dreading all along. "What?!"

"All you have to do is enter through my rear end, reach Honchkrow, and lead him along by zapping the walls of my small intestine with that stick. I believe once he reaches my colon my body can take care of the rest at its own pace. There's more space, so-"

"Are you crazy?!" you blurted out. "You know what you're asking me to do?!"

"I'm aware! That's why I'm willing to do anything you ask afterwards. You'll be rewarded!"

At least the offer of a reward was there. You decided to take advantage of this. "I have three conditions. If you don't accept any of them, I won't help you" you were tempted to say they were demands, but you didn't want Nidoking to think you were cravenly taking advantage of his pain, even if you totally were. Nidoking grunted, but listened nonetheless. "One. I want you to spare Honchkrow once he's out"

"...I feared you would ask that of me"

"Promise it!"

Nidoking was silent for a moment before nodding. "Fine. What are the other two?"

"I also want to stay in this manor for a while. I'm not sure how long"

"I was going to offer that anyway"

"And last, I want you to tell me everything you know about the small human from long ago. Understood?"

That one Nidoking didn't expect at all. He raised his head, glancing at you with what you interpreted as an inquisitive expression. Had you perhaps blown your cover? Nidoking was silent for a rather long minute, until... "Alright. I shall tell you everything. I accept your conditions"

The preparations for the rather unpleasant task you signed up to do were quick. Nidoking, being afraid something could happen to you, encouraged you to root through the miner's shrunken items. "You should take the helmet with the light. Does it fit you?"

"It's tight, but I can handle it"

That seemed to be an answer Nidoking expected now. Now you were sure: he definitely knew now you were a tiny human. "Take the gas mask and the gloves too. Those can save your life"

"How, exactly?"

"Have you forgotten? I'm a Poison-type. Almost everything inside me is toxic. Honchkrow should be okay, if a tad ill for a few days, but you're much smaller. You may not resist like he can" That made sense to you. You donned the gas mask. It was certainly not going to protect you against smells, but it would at least keep you safe from airborne toxins. "Do you remember the plan?"

You held high the electric device. "Poke the lining of your intestines with this every time Honchkrow gets stuck. It will contract the walls and push him further along the way" You tested the lamp on the helmet. It was rather strong.

"Exactly. Push him to my large intestine and then you and him will go along for the ride. I..." he apologetically bowed his head and sighed, like what he was going to say was rather painful for him. "I'm sorry I'm making you do this. This is rather humiliating for both of us"

"You're not getting any kind of pleasure from this, are you?"

"Of course not! What are you thinking?!" he roared, offended and bewildered. That was a relief to you. You really preferred someone reluctant instead of someone who was looking forward to having you inside their body. Having made the preparations, Nidoking extended his hand on the floor, beckoning you to ride it. You held onto his thumb while he raised his hand to his face for a few last words. "I wish you the best of luck. I promise you I will fulfill all of your conditions" and with that, he positioned himself.

Slowly, Nidoking laid on his belly on the floor, grunting at the discomfort, and barely managed to move his hand to his behind. He laboriously moved his tail aside, and held his hand in front of his anus, barely open for you. You were right in front of the muscular slit that would lead deep into the king, and he was doing you the courtesy of letting you do this at your own pace. Now that you were about to start, you made sure the gas mask was well placed, turned on the light on the helmet, and went all over the plan in your head again.

Suddenly, this seemed like an herculean task to you. You had fit in Honchkrow's rectum. It wasn't big, but you had managed to fit in with more than enough space to move. Now that giant-to-you bird was inside Nidoking, and Nidoking was many, many, many times larger than Honchkrow. The width of the small intestine would be humongous to you, you doubted you would even be able to jump up and reach halfway, or even one quarter towards the ceiling. If one of the narrowest passageways inside Nidoking was that big, how would the more spacious areas, such as his colon, be to you?
