"Keep quiet ya rat or I swear I'm swallowing ya..." Zorua hissed as she kept running, cursing you: Sylveon seemed to have heard the human she was carrying (more like kidnapping), because she was now running in her direction, she could tell by the sound of paw-steps growing louder behind her.

Zorua sped up, but couldn't really orientate herself in the thick, pink mist.

She felt the leaves of the bushes tickling her - where was she going?

The vixen soon found out in a very painful way as she ran into a tree, her muzzle crashing into the trunk; inside her mouth, you were suddenly flung forward, hitting Zorua's sharp teeth and falling back like a log.

"Hold still!" Sylveon shouted as she ran towards the tree... her heart seemed to leap in her chest as she noticed that Zorua was fully visible - the impact had nullified her illusion, her focus broken.

Zorua noticed too.

Hastily, she jumped to her paws.

Simultaneously, Sylveon formed a ball of white light in her mouth, before she shot the Moonblast at the dazed fox in an attempt to incapacitate her.

The unevolved dark-type noticed it and jumped to the side, barely avoiding the attack, which caused an explosion upon hitting a tree.

Sylveon was approaching.

Zorua trembled slightly - was this the end?

She looked at the fairy-type, then she looked around, hoping to find a single way out... and, finally, the mist faded, the dark garden returning.

And, behind Sylveon, the back door. Had she been running in circles?

Zorua discovered that she didn't care. She had to get out, and fast.

As Sylveon approached, Zorua did the unthinkable: she leaned forward, her dirty paws rising and placing themselves on Sylveon's silky muzzle; then, Zorua jumped past the pixie, landing straight behind her as she started running once more.

Sylveon recovered quickly and began chasing the vixen.

"Oh no, you don't!"
1142222222222221122112222111221221213211.title: An unpleasant reunion

1142222222222221122112222111221221213213.content:
"You mentioned that Zorua might be hiding in Leafeon's garden?" you recalled, rubbing your eyes and yawning from the lack of sleep you were being subjected to.

Sylveon nodded meekly, her gaze glued on you.

"Yeah..." she verbally confirmed,
"But it was... y'know, a dream. We can't know for sure where Zorua is..."

"... Or when she'll come and get me back..." you shivered at your own statement, remembering the sadistic gaze of the dark-type vixen right before she left the secret room.

Sylveon smiled - a clear attempt to respect her earlier statement about being positive.

"She won't try anything as long as you're with me!" she exclaimed encouragingly, before her smile faded as she put two and two together,
"Unless..." She trailed off.

You nodded.

"Illusions. She can take me and make you believe I'm still there... like she did this morning..." you recalled resignedly, knowing that if Zorua actually did take you again, you wouldn't be able to do anything but flail helplessly while screaming at top of your lungs.

Both actions could be reduced to nothingness by a single movement of the vixen's paw.

Silence fell between you and Sylveon as she simply stared at you and you stared back at her.

A while passed where nothing was done and nothing was said.

But then, Sylveon's expression changed into a triumphant smile.

"I know!" she piped up, suddenly rising on all fours, making the bed tremble dangerously beneath you.

"A trap!" Sylveon said, regarding your tiny body by her pink paws,
"All we have to do is to set up a trap!" she clarified upon noting your confused expression.

You cocked your head.

How was she planning to trick a tricky pokemon into a trap? That seemed the kind of things Zorua were good at...

"Sylveon," you started,
"How do we do that?"

In response, Sylveon's eyelids partially covered her eyes; she didn't give a response, but that dejected expression and the still present smile while she stared at you were enough.

"No!" you couldn't believe it.
"No no no!"

She was going to use you as a bait!

"Oh, relax, I've got a plan!" Sylveon stated,
"You'll just have to wander around while you search for Zorua; meanwhile, I'll follow you from... um... a safety distance, so that she won't notice me. And whenever you find her, you yell for me and I'll come! It's perfect!" she explained.

Your heart skipped a beat.

"Sylveon that's crazy!" you protested, but a silky ribbon hastily wrapped around you and lifted you from the bed.

"And it's gonna work!" Sylveon responded as he jumped from the bed to the floor and started walking towards the door, you in tow.

"I don't like this plan..."

--

Darkness was all you could see... so, basically, you couldn't see anything.

You felt the floor beneath your feet as the giant fairy gently placed you down, giving you a push with her ribbon.

"Just walk around," she whispered,
"If anything happens, I'll be right behind you."

You gulped, and were about to protest further, but a look at Sylveon's face told you that she wasn't going to accept a refusal as an answer.

So you bit the bullet, swallowed and followed her command as you began walking onto shaky legs.

Sylveon watched you disappear in darkness; after a couple minutes, when she couldn't hear your tiny steps anymore, she began walking too, following you as slowly as she could.

You looked around, watching every step as you proceeded, deeper into the cave and closer (or further?) from Zorua.

You tried you control your heartbeat, but the fear of why the tricky dark-type could do to you if this plan failed - and there was a high possibility that it was going to fail - made it hard.

Sylveon was following you, but what were you supposed to do? She told you to ‘search for Zorua’, but what did that even imply?

Did you have to look into one of the many doors? Some were open, but the majority of them were closed, and it was too dark for you to see anything withou getting too close anyway. And you absolutely didn't want to get too-

Your musings were brutally interrupted as your face met with a soft but firm wall that made you stumble back and fall on your rear end.

"Ow..." you whimpered as you rubbed your sore butt, before you urgently realized the you bumped into someone... and that couldn't be Sylveon, because she was behind you.

Slowly - very slowly - you craned your neck and looked up to see who it was...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213213.title: The trap

choices: Zorua was blocked by another Eeveelution!
11422222222222211221122221112212212133.content:
Air seemed to move as the invisible Zorua darted away, almost blowing you away with the mere force caused by her dash, her steps causing tremors that shook your whole body.

Sylveon frenetically looked around, uselessly trying to spot Zorua; Glaceon had another idea.

Instead of stopping, time now seemed to go in slow motion.

The ice-type opened her mouth wide, her belly was sucked in, her teeth shined, her legs trembled slightly and her eyes closed as she focused.

Sylveon stared at her ice-type counterpart, before her gaze fell upon you; you were uncovered, and Glaceon's attack could result deadly.

The white and pink fairy hastily ran towards you and knelt; two silky ribbons wrapped around you as the fairy pulled you closer, shielding you as Glaceon finally let loose her Icy Wind across the whole room, coating the carpet in a thin layer of ice while making you shiver in Sylveon's grasp.

Soon, the whole room, walls and floor, were covered by ice.

The Icy Wind came to an end, and the ice-type that caused it looked around, noticing Sylveon shaking off crystals of ice from her silky fur and tail, her ribbons still holding you tight against her chest bow.

You were physically shaking.

"W-Warn m-me the n-next time..." you said through chattering teeth.

Glaceon shot a neutral look, before looking around the room, searching for her dark-type target.

Sylveon did the same, still squeezing you protectively; she didn't know what the Zorua had done to you, but she only needed a glance at you, covered in dirt, dried saliva and smelly slime to get an idea of what you were put through.

The two Eeveelutions remained quiet, a deafening silence falling in the room; you emulated them and stayed silent. Initially, none of the two pokemon noticed anything.

But then, Sylveon's sensible ears caught a faint sound: shattered ice.

She turned around and suddenly gasped, causing Glaceon to turn around.

One of Sylveon's free ribbons was pointing to a particular spot: cold crystals of ice were hovering in midair, like held by a psychic attack; the ice on the carpeted floor was being shattered, replaced by paw prints as Zorua walked, trying to get away.

For a moment, the invisible dark-type seemed to stop. Behind her illusion, Zorua noticed the two Eeveelutions staring straight at her.

Uh-oh.

Immediately, the dark type started running again.

Sylveon and Glaceon didn't lose any time as they ran behind the dark-type vixen, chasing her as your former tormentor ran to the door...
11422222222222211221122221112212212133.title: Escaping from the grip of ice

choices: Tell them the truth. You did see where Zorua went.
You lie. You didn't see a thing.
114222222222222112211222211122122121333.content:
Pieces of ice blew backwards off of Zorua's invisible form as she neared the door, kicking up sprinkles of snow in her hardly hidden scamper. With a flash and a metallic thunk, all hints of the vixen's dart forward stopped. All hints, that is, except for the dull groan of a very agitated dark type. Both Eeveelutions screeched to a halt, the little roller-coaster ride you were getting against Sylveon stirring your stomach with its abrupt end. Glaceon was the first to recognize what had happened.

"E- Espeon?"

A pink mass appeared at the other side of the door, distorted by light screen it had cast to block the Zorua's escape. "Is this like... an attack the poorly hidden Zorua situation or...?"

"Just don't let them get out of this room!" interjected Sylveon.

The psychic type nodded, which doubled as a way to give her orb a straight shot forward. "Stand back then." The two other Eeveelutions quickly doing so, Espeon sent a beam forward, piercing the barrier and colliding with Zoura. Her invisibility disrupted, the vixen was blasted back in a weightless journey to the center of the icy room. The Zorua slipped-and-slided until she found her footing.

Espeon walked forward with a slow confidence, staring down her target with a cutting look in her eyes. "I wouldn't try anything else. There's nothing you can do that I can't detect."

"D-" Zorua seemed to get caught on her words, a sickly smirk on her muzzle. "Detect this!" The fox's form jumped forward in the blink of an eye, so fast that not even the all-seeing one of Espeon fully comprehend it. A shadowy blast sent Espeon tumbling back. Zorua dissipated in the flash of dark, emerging out of the void and into the hallway.

"Oh goodness, she's out!" Sylveon shouted, you feeling her shrill voice shake your small structure.

"Espeon, are you..."

"Fine. I'm fine." she assured, paw to head. She forced herself to shake off the disorienting spell, the darkness that had hit her dissipating at her feet.

"Take the human, Espy. I'm not letting her get away." Sylveon tried to insist, holding you poised in front of her gleaming eyes. A blink was the only answer she offered, a psychic grip forming around you. It tickled a bit, but you mostly felt wary about being in the possession of a Pokemon that had just been engulfed by a surge of darkness. The Espeon seemed to read this in you, whether it was from your expression alone or the inner-thoughts she easily could've pried, and hovered you close to Glaceon.

"Here. You take him." she said flatly, a dark-blue paw becoming your only leverage. Espeon gave you a strange look before teleporting after Sylveon.

"Aw c'mon, I want to... Egh..." Glaceon gave up, mostly because she no longer had anyone her words would reach but a shrunken human. Better than no one, though. "So... some day, huh?"

---

"It's another fake." Sylveon said, staring exasperated at another mockingly cute Poke Doll that had replaced the once convincing form of a runaway Zorua. "How many of these things did she make..."

"She's desperate." Espeon returned in a bode of half-baked confidence. Her head ached with a dark disruptance, cluttering her clarvoyance with unhelpful white noise. "...I just can't get a read on her location."

"She's certainly.... tricky." Sylveon said through a sigh, shaking her head with a growing bit of self-pity. "And I fell right through her tricks. Making me think she was a poor, defenseless Eevee. Oh, what was I thinking?"

"There was no way for you to of known... If it was me, though..."

"Yeah, yeah, yeah..."

"Should've just told me about her when you thought she was... scuse me... 'a poor, defenseless Eevee'. I would've saw through her the instant I walked in."

Sylveon rolled her eyes, turning away from Espeon. Lost in thought, she failed to immediately realize that one of her ribbons had pointed itself straight down an adjacent hall until what it was being attracted by emerged from it's dark end. The form of Zoura.

"Well how about this one Miss Know-It-All? Real or fake?"

Espeon batted at the orb on her head, trying to mentally clear out the pesky interference. "Well, maybe if I didn't have the worst kind of headache in history I could tell you."

"I'm going to guess..." Sylveon started to charge up an attack, eyes locked on the Zoura's own glowing slits. "...fa-"

A sharp sniffle, followed by a dramatically loud bellow sounded out from the Zorua, tears beginning to stream down their muzzle. "O- Oh, please... I'm so sorry, I... I never meant no harm. I was just playin' around. Please, don-"

A harsh psychic hold seized the Zorua, stopping their dramatic show of emotion dead in its tracks.

"Fake tears." muttered Espeon. "Don't even need half a mind for that one." With a slight mental push, Zorua was flung against a wall, taking down part of the elaborate banners adorning it.

"Geez Espy... A little much maybe?"

"Oh, you're just protective of your 'artistry'." she snarked back, though a part of her was a little guilty of the damage she had done. Not to say she wouldn't roll with it. In mere moments, she had bundled the Zorua up in a mess of the fancy clothe, making sure to keep her original hold on the conniving dark type to leave no room for them to escape. "There. No chance she's getting away now."

----

*CRASH*

Glaceon jumped great big, the reflex shaking your entire world and making your own jump feel like nothing.

"What on Arceus' blue Earth?!" she cried, sights set on where the sound had come from. Breaking from that still surprise, Glaceon sent you to the very familiar place against her chest-fluff, dashing out of the room in seconds. "What's going on?!" she called out, voice bouncing all over, as well as resonating so much within you than it made your ears ring. Following her own ears, Glaceon skidded through the halls until she reached the other Eeveelutions by a pile of unmounted poles and fabric, wrapped into an effective bundle. Glaceon guided you to the ground, closing the distance between her and the hopefully fruitful mess the others had made.

"We got her." Espeon chimed, perhaps a little too pleased with herself.

"Now, now... She isn't some Joltik we were trying to drive out. We need to... have a talk."

"With her?! What's there even to say."

You, personally, had a few hundred things to say to the over-sized vixen, none of them being particularly kind. You didn't really want to, though. You were perfectly content with never thinking about the Zorua, or what she did to you ever again, let alone talking to her.

Eventually, your focus drifted away from the argument the trio had only just begun to have. Through your countless thoughts, something caught your eye back in reality. At the entrance to the now frozen former-room of 'Eevee's', was a stray Pokedoll, a swirling portal starting to grow under it until the entire plush of a Clefairy was engulfed.

But that was nothing in comparison to what you saw next. From the mess of banners, came the Zorua, seemingly unphased. Immediately, you felt a yell rise up in your throat. But before you could get it out, Zorua gave you a look of sheer death, pointing an unsheathed claw from a running yet silent mouth before running it along her chest-fluff to emulate the cutting of a neck.

The message was clear, and it chilled you to the bone.

As Zorua dissapeared into a dimly-lit hall, and you tried to control your copious shaking, Sylveon finally set things back onto a track she had no idea was derailed.

"Let's just see what she has to say for herself. Maybe a little more than insults I hope."

Espeon and Glaceon nodded in tandem. Espeon untangled the banners like they were a bow, and the Pokemon they were finally able to secure was the present. Instead of a subdued Zorua, what everyone found was something a lot more akin to a present: a single Poke Doll.

The halls erupted into a cacophony of voices. Except your voice which had completely and utterly escaped you.

"How... was that not her?" Sylveon asked the air in shock, trying to wrap her head around it like it was the most foreign concept.

"I have no idea. I.... If this headache would just stop I could find her in a heartbeat!"

"Headache? Do you want me to make you an ice-pack?"

"No... its was that attack. I never should've let her lay a claw on me." Espeon groaned, before lifting her head back up to look at you. Something changed in her expression.

"What do we do now? She could be anywhere... Tricking anyone into believing her cruel illusions."

Espeon let out a deep sigh, grabbing everyone's attention. Her eyes glimmered with something strange, leaving you lost in her bottomless stare. Like she was looking straight into your soul. "Human. Did you see where Zorua went?" she stated simply, almost dully.

The two other sets of eyes locked onto you, fully invested in your answer by Espeon's confident air alone. You felt like a deer in the headlights, cheeks burning red. It wasn't just their piercing eyes, and their awaiting ears, but hers.The one's you knew were somewhere close, watching and listening for what your answer would be along with that wicked smirk.

With a deep swallow, you...
114222222222222112211222211122122121333.title: Zorua was blocked by another Eeveelution!

choices: You went to find another Eeveelution!
There was no need to - one of them was passing by!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
"Yeah," as the first word left your mouth, you had to pause to breath in deeply,
"Yeah I saw her."

Espeon cocked her head, and you were suddenly aware that the full attention of the three giantesses was on you.

Your arm rose, then fell and stopped in mid-air; a shaky finger pointed to the hall where Zorua disappeared.

‘Big mistake.’ told your mind.

Espeon, Glaceon and Sylveon, all looked at the hall for a second. Then, Sylveon adopted a firm expression as she began moving towards the hall, her ribbons swinging quietly behind her as she did.

Right after Sylveon, Espeon started moving towards the dimly lit hall; after a moment of hesitation, Glaceon, whose paw you were resting on, followed, balancing on three legs.

The white and pink Eeveelution was the first to disappear into the hall, but she soon came back into sight as all three pokemon (and you) stepped into a circular space surrounded by stone walls - no wonder, you were in a cave; several doors adorned the walls, but one in particular drew the attention of Espeon.

"Hey..." she whispered, paw pointing to one of the doors on the side. You hastily took notice that the door the psychic-type was pointing at was slightly ajar.

You swallowed.

Whatever was on the other side of that door, Zorua was there too.

"Hey! That's my room!" Glaceon spoke while sounding not too happy.

Before you even noticed, Glaceon, along with Sylveon and Espeon, began moving again, this time towards the open door.

None of them spoke during the short journey from the hall to the door; then, one of Sylveon's ribbons went to the door handle.

With a firm shove, the door opened, revealing what undeniably was Glaceon's bedroom: the warmth seemed to disappear all of a sudden, replaced by a freezing cold air; there was a small bed in a corner, while the floor was covered in thick ice, which shined despite the room being quite dark.

And, in the middle of the room, a Zorua sat, with an expression of terror painted on the face.

"You and us..." Sylveon started as she carefully walked onto the ice covering the floor.
"We need to- another!" one of Sylveon's ribbons had extended to the terrified Zorua, but it faded to reveal a poke-doll.

Espeon groaned.

"If only it wasn't for this headache, I'd-" what Espeon would have done, you never knew.

"Oh!" Glaceon screamed, causing the other two Eeveelutions to look at her, noticing the ice-type laying onto the ice.

"I'm okay..." Glaceon reassured as she stood back up.

Espeon and Sylveon, however, kept staring at her, one with an expression of confusion and the other with her jaw almost touching the ice covering the floor.

"What? I said I'm okay! I just tripped!" Glaceon repeated, before remembering about something.

"Human, are you-" Glaceon quickly understood why her two counterparts were looking at her weirdly.

Where was the human?

--

The moment Glaceon fell, you tumbled down your perch on her paw.

For a brief second, you felt the cold ice making contact with you, before you were suddenly introduced to a dark, smelly yet familiar place.

Looking around, you noticed that you were surrounded by sharp teeth you recognized; and you paled as you realized you were in Zorua's mouth!

An eternity of trying to convince yourself that this was a nightmare passed, while things shook wildly.

But, after a while of Zorua doing unknown activities, her mouth suddenly stopped shaking.

And, as roughly as you entered, you were suddenly spat out of the cavernous mouth; you hit a stone wall, the saliva surrounding you breaking your fall.

You meekly looked up, noticing that, indeed, a certain dark-type vixen covered your whole view, panting while glaring at you.

"Ya made the biggest mistake of your life." she spoke with cold fury in her voice, the effect ruined by the fact she was panting from her run.

You swallowed.

"Give me-" a dirty, giant paw moved to your neck, cutting off your breathing while pushing your head into the wall; at least, you couldn't breathe in the smell of her paw.
"... One reason why I shouldn't kill ya right now."

The red paw left your neck, but stopped at an extremely short distance.

You inhaled deeply several times, not caring about inhaling the smell of Zorua's paw.

"I..." you coughed a bit, interrupting yourself,
"P-Please... I'll do anything..." you said.

The dark giantess began snickering.

"Ya already do that, have you forgotten ya lil' rat? You're a slave - no, you're my slave!" she exclaimed, causing you to feel utterly humiliated.

However, you didn't have much time to think about your feelings, Zorua was going on:
"And d'you know what happens when slaves betray their master?"

Again, the paw inched closer to you neck.

Your head was yet again pushed against the wall, Zorua's head moving closer too, so close that you could feel her smelly breath on your body, which had turned a milky-white color.

But then, Zorua's paw was suddenly removed.

"If only ya weren't so damn useful to me, I'd-" you could only guess what she was about to say, because she didn't say it.

Instead, another voice spoke.

"Hold still!"

You turned your head to see a heavenly sight: Sylveon, Espeon and Glaceon running in direction of the dark-type vixen.

Zorua, forgetting about you, cloaked herself behind the usual illusion and seemingly faded, though you felt the floor beneath your shaking as she ran from the three Eeveelutions.

As for the three giantesses, Espeon ran past you without even noticing you; or perhaps she did, but totally ignored you.

Sylveon and Glaceon stopped as they noticed you pale and covered in saliva, dirt clinging to your neck.

"Are you okay?" the fairy-type giantess spoke worriedly.

You nodded, still too shaken to talk.

Both giantesses sighed.

"Okay, listen: you stay here - we'll get her." Glaceon hastily said.

Without adding anything else, she bolted away; Sylveon gave you one last glance, before she sprinted off too, leaving you alone to think about what just happened.

Then, fear made you spring back on your feet: what if Zorua came back here first? You needed to hide!

Or maybe...

"Hmm..." you wondered if it was a wise choice to risk trying to find another of the Eeveelutions.

It would be, though, a safer option to have one of them watch over you while Sylveon, Espeon and Glaceon hunted Zorua down.

But... would they have been willing to help?
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Another quick taste of fear

1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
You didn't stew on the dilemma for long, a knot forming in your stomach at the thought of getting snatched up by Zorua like you were a toy with not an ounce of agency. If it weren't for the nippiness of the air, you would've actually been able to distinguish your chills. Wiping off your dirtied neck, you began a careful walk back outside Glaceon's room. You hugged the edge of the doorway, looking out and scanning both ends of the hall like you were preparing to cross the street. Except, instead of oncoming cars, the thing you were watching out for was a giant, sadistic vixen that probably wouldn't allow herself to be plainly seen anyway.

You breathed in deeply, bolting out of the room so fast you almost tripped on the icy ground. As the squeaking sound of your shoes sliding against ice echoed out in all directions, your need to book it only increased, bringing you to somehow run even faster.

You didn't know where to go exactly, though you obviously favored high-tailing it the opposite way to where Zorua had gotten chased off to. You just needed to find someone. Anyone, as long as they didn't have a red and black flame of fur on their noggin, and a horrible, crooked smile. Anyone.

Your run stopped just as quickly as it had started at a close-by noise, soft on your ears. A gentle humming. Like you were ease-dropping on someone's shower. You followed the song to a strange sight, one that contrasted with the rest of the cave with its untamed display of nature. A twisting spiral of tree roots, creating a crevice that looked just barely big enough to squeeze an Eeveelution through, but perfectly manageable for someone of your size.

You weren't sure what awaited you, but you weren't going waste your precious time preparing yourself for it. You were starting to get used to things happening without having done any steeling of yourself before hand, and that trend didn't seem like it would be stopping anytime soon.

After a bit of a trek through a jungle gym of roots and vines, you emerged in a more homey place, kitted out with decorative flora, grown-over furniture, and wooden adornments along the wall, seeming to be created out of the wood that encapsulated the place itself. The whole den looked like it was inside of a tree, carrying the rustic scent of sawdust and magnolia. Coupled with this, was the song that continued to hum out, now sounding closer than ever. But before you could identify where it was coming from, it stopped, replaced by a soft gasp. You felt a strong sense that you were being watched. Watched from above.

You gulped, turning your head upwards to discover that the room had a bit more to it than you had thought, reaching up tall with pales and pots holding finely-kept flowers within intricately designed holders, everything bathed in an orb of sunlight. Something else up above shone bright, too, though it froze you up instead of warming you. The two eyes of a similarly motionless Leafeon, seeming to be stuck in the state of catching up with the sight of you.

"Y- You... You're that shrunken human," she simply said, breaking her silence.

"Yeah, I-"

You were cut off by the grass-type leaping from her perch onto a small bed in the corner, kicking up a sweet smell into the air.

"Are you... alone?" she asked with a tilt of the head, stepping down to your level and lowering her head.

You swallowed a lump in your throat. "Right now... Yes, I am. B- But there's a reason I came in here, I..."

Again, you were interrupted, this time by a feeling of suction around your body. Leafeon was sniffing you.

"You smell... really bad." she stated bluntly, nose wrinkling.

"Yeah. There's kind of a long story to that... If you're willing to hear it out."

Leafeon blushed a bit, retreating into herself. "I already know some of it..."

"You do?" you returned with a hushed sense to my tone, legitimately surprised.

She backed away even farther, her cheeks only continuing to bloom roses. "A- About what happened... With you and Glaceon."

Now it was your turn to blush, connecting the dots almost instantly.

"N- No, no! It wasn't that... Well it was partly that, but.... uh..."

You sighed, losing your voice under her unreadable glare. After a moment though, in your flustered silence, you saw, and felt, that glare soften.

"You seem stressed"

Well, call this one a psychic type because we've got ourselves a mind-reader.

"I am. I've kind of had my life flash before my eyes like... six times in the last hour.

Now, Leafeon's eyes lost their hard to interpret cloudiness, bleeding into something at least curious.

"Six times?"

"I... might be exaggerating a bit.... Or maybe I'm being generous, I.... can't really tell anymore."

Leafeon started to return to her previous proximity, ears poised like leaves as sharp as knifes. At the very least, you had her attention. And maybe that was all you could ask from the shy grass-type after wandering into her tree-den without any notice and clashing its pleasant smell with your own heinous one.

With a deep breath, you decided to tell her everything that had happened.

---

"And... then I heard your singing, and.... yeah... I came in here." you finished, judging the reaction of what had mostly stayed a silent audience, if not for a few gasps and gags.

Her expression remained hard to read, not too metallic to be cold, but not too deep to look truly and utterly concerned. She seemed bashful, if anything, a light pinkness remaining on her face.

"You heard my singing?"

Not the first question you expected her to ask, that's for sure.

"Uh, yeah..." You stuttered a bit, trying your best to not miss a beat after such a tonal whiplash.

She prodded at the leaf atop her head, turning a reddened cheek. "Did you... like it?"

You almost couldn't help but chuckle, opting to let out a puff of air instead.

"Y- Yeah, it was... nice."

Leafeon simply smiled, and as pleasant as you wanted the thought of just indulging in a casual, if a tad awkward conversation to be, your state of fear and continued recovery from your near brush with death kept it an exasperating one.

"But, look... I need your help, okay? Zorua is unpredictable, and I don't think she's going to leave unless she gets me back in her paws... And with how I gave away where she was hiding... she's probably going to be even rougher to me if she ever does."

Leafeon visibly winced at this, clearly just as troubled by the thought as you were. At least... that's what you hoped. Best case scenario.

"So... until the rest of them get back... can you keep me with you? I won't be a bother or anything. I just... don't feel safe out there."

Leafeon's eyes closed, considering your request. You hoped you were able to express your plight in a way that got through to her, but as the seconds went by with the Eeveelution remaining completely silent, and almost motionless as well excepting the sway of her tail, you started to grow not to be so sure.

After what felt like forever, Leafeon finally opened her eyes, the focused glint in them wordlessly showing that she was ready to give her answer...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Nature's Refuge...?

choices: You remained quiet as Zorua snatched you and left...
Espeon suddenly came by, finally having managed to detect Zorua!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Your heart jumped in relief as you saw the upside-down movement Leafeon's head made as you request sank into her mind.

"Yo-You're going to keep me with you?" you asked, seeking for a verbal confirm.

Leafeon didn't immediately reply.

She loomed above you, regarding your tiny body with a concerned spark in her hazel eyes.

Then, her mouth opened as she spoke softly,

"This Z-Zorua... seems dangerous to someone like y-you..." she stammered shyly.

‘And to you, too. Ask Espeon.’ you mused, doing your best to keep eye contact.

Leafeon didn't seem to notice your slight change of expression and continued,

"So, why not?"

The wave of relief that this simple sentence triggered in you caused your legs to melt and you to fall rear-down on the grass that covered the floor of Leafeon's bedroom.

"Oh, thank you..." you said with a sigh.

The ground beneath you quaked a bit as the giant Leafeon approached; a brown paw slid to you, gently snatching you onto its back.

Again, the nose of the giantess wrinkled.

"Sorry... but you really smell bad..."

"That's what happens when you end up in-" before you could finish your sentence, recalling horrible memories of an endless suffering, you found your mouth, nose and eyes being assaulted by a strong scent.

You began coughing as your lungs started to fill up with the scent; only once you stopped coughing did you find out that your whole being seemed to be soothed.

Also, the bad smell you emanated earlier was gone.

Leafeon wore a timid smile on her face.

"Aromatherapy..." she explained in a calm tone, her cheeks growing a shade of red.
"I think it should have solved some of your problems..."

By that, she was obviously referring to your stress and smell. Because Aromatherapy definitely didn't solve a sadistic giant vixen that was probably in the same place you currently were, unseen.

"Yeah... thanks..." you mumbled in response, trying to smile; the thought of Zorua made it look like you had just been stung by some poison-type.

"You're welcome... it must have been a terrible day for you..." Leafeon emphatically said.

That said, your world began shaking as the grass-type made a leap in the air and jumped from the floor the the small bed in the corner, with the side effect of you tumbling off her paw and onto the green bed.

"Why don't you rest for a while? You'll be safe here... until the others don't capture Zorua, I'll watch over you." she assured with a sincere smile.

Took aback by the display of kindness only Sylveon showed so far, you smiled back and gladly took the advice, closing your eyes.

After spending the day between two mouths, a digestive tract, a bladder and a butt...

After a few minutes, you fell into a deep sleep.

--

"She must have went this way!"

Zorua gritted her teeth as she ran across the hall, the sound of the Eeveelutios' paw-steps resounding behind her.

"Hey Espy, that headache of yours?" Glaceon asked as she ran beside the psychic-type.

"It's... getting better, but I still can't sense her!" Espeon replied, causing the invisible Zorua to grin.

She rounded a corner; her left eye caught a glimpse of a crevice formed by tree roots. Such crevice led to an impressive garden.

Zorua grinned, while the voices of the three Eeevelutions grew louder behind her.

They weren't going to find her in such maze, she thought as she squeezed herself through the crevice.

She heard someone humming.

Leafeon, judging by the place.

Carefully, Zorua ventured deep into the literal jungle, until she came to a halt as she noted a cream/green pokemon, kneeling over a few plants, tail wagging. The humming came from her, Zorua noted.

But what Zorua noticed when she turned her gaze made her smirk.

--

"Hey, she could be hiding in Leafeon's room..." Glaceon pointed out, looking at the green display of grass and plants.

"It may be..." Sylveon agreed, looking down with worry,
"I just hope she didn't go back to get the human..."

"There's a good chance he's fine. Focus on what's important." Espeon huffed, earning a flare from her fairy-type counterpart.

"Yeah, I forgot you wanted to eat him yourself, huh?" Glaceon recalled, causing Espeon's lilac fur to grow red.

"Shut up." she said.

Sylveon sighed.

"As much as I hate to admit... Espy is right, we've got to search for Zorua first... If she has the human, we'll get him as well..." Sylveon paused to look around, glancing from the entrance to Leafeon's room to the straight hall that led to Vaporeon's room, to her own room and, further, to the living room the Eeveelutions shared.

"I know what you're thinking, and it's a good idea." Espeon said, looking to a confused Glaceon.
"Let's split up - I'll check Leafeon's room. I have more possibilities to find that Zorua in there." the psychic-type smugly said as she squeezed herself through the crevice without even waiting for an answer.

Sylveon and Glaceon looked at each other, sighing deeply, before proceeding further into the cave.

--

You woke up, hearing a familiar tune being sung.

Your eyes opened into two tiny openings as you glanced across the garden, noticing the giant Leafeon humming to herself once again, her back turned to you.

You smiled a bit as you watched her, feeling quite soothed for the first time since you set foot in this cave.

"Havin' fun?"

Each hair on your body sprang up as you heard her voice beside you.

It was a mere whisper, but it was enough for you to recognize Zorua.

You instinctively looked to your side, finding nothing.

Yet, Zorua was there, you could feel her.

You didn't reply, you didn't move, your eyelids sealed themselves as you desperately tried to give the vixen the impression that you were still asleep.

"I know you ain't sleepin', lil' one," Zorua whispered and, judging by the hot, smelly air that assaulted you from an imprecise point beside you, she had leaned in closer.

"D'ya know what happens now?" she whispered, before quickly adding,
"Don't answer. I'm gonna take you before that plant-freak turns around and then we're outta here. And if you try to shout, you'll discover how bad I can really be."

You swallowed, but remained still as a hot and smelly wave assaulted you; Zorua had opened her mouth, which was ready to take you in...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Shared Shelter

choices: Zorua sneaked out of the garden and back into the den, unnoticed...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
True, you couldn't see where Zorua exactly was, but you could literally feel her mouth near you; her hot, smelly breath overwhelmed you, filling your nose with its horrible, dreadful stench.

Your eyes darted in direction of Leafeon, who was quietly humming with her back turned to you, happily thinking that you were asleep; little she did know about the third presence in her garden that was about to snatch you in her mouth like you were a chew toy.

But you weren't going to let that happen.

While your life flashed before your eyes for what had to be the seventh time today, your mouth opened in a loud scream,

"Leafeon!"

Time seemed to stop in its tracks; behind her illusion, Zorua remained with her jaw hanging open while Leafeon's ears pointed upwards as her attention was drawn.

Slowly, the green pokemon turned around, looking at you on her bed, while you felt Zorua's mouth retreating, not before having let out one last hiss,

"You're dead."

"Yes?" Leafeon asked as she slowly approached the bed, wondering the reason of such alarmed scream.
"Something wrong?" she asked as she noticed your face, which carried a look of absolute terror.

Your heart pounded, your mind raced - you had her attention now, how were you going to convince the giantess of the invisible Zorua in her garden?

An idea sprang up.

"Ehm..." you started, vaguely embarrassed as the plan was formulated in your mind,
"I've... huh... had a nightmare..."

This caused the invisible vixen to perk up, wasn't the human gonna rat her out after all?

Maybe she wasn't going to kill him when she managed to get her paws-

"Could you use Aromatherapy again? It felt kinda good before..." you murmured, embarrassed.

Zorua's eyes shrunk; Leafeon smiled as your request sank into her mind.

"Of course," she chimed with an eager nod of her head as she began emitting that familiar, soothing wave that smelled of grass.

Beside you, someone began coughing as the smell assaulted her nose.

You watched attentively as Leafeon stopped to glance at the sudden apparition of a Zorua on her bed.

The dark-type vixen coughed, her focus broken by Aromatherapy and her illusion dispelled.

Leafeon backed up slightly.

"Are you...?" she looked at you, seeking for a confirm, which she found in your wide open eyes and gritted teeth, an expression that shouted ‘Yes!’

Without thinking twice, Leafeon picked you up by the front of your already ruined shirt with her mouth;

Dangling in an uncomfortable position, you watched as Zorua stopped coughing to glare at Leafeon, and by extension, you; those ice-blue eyes fixed a death glare on you, a glare that threatened you of the worse things you could think of if she ever managed to get her paws on you again.

"Okay, here's the deal," she said to Leafeon,
"Gimme that lil' squeakin' rat you have there and I'll get goin',"

The timid Leafeon looked at the smaller pokemon, somewhat intimidated, not knowing that Zorua was even more intimidated by the fully evolved Eeveelution that could have her knocked out at any time.

You found yourself swinging left-to-right as Leafeon shook her head, signaling that she wasn't going to comply; to empathize her thought, the leaf on her head glowed bright green as she performed Leaf Blade, slashing Zorua with it and sending her flying several feet back.

You tracked her fall with your eyes, which never left the form of the vixen.

After a particularly rough landing that ruined several of Leafeon's plants, Zorua remained still for a couple moments, just glaring at the bigger pokemon who stared back, you dangling from her lips.

It would have been a comic sight if it wasn't for the fact that she was discovered and hit pretty badly.

"Damn it..." the vixen stood back on all fours and gritted her teeth as she stared at you.

Her fangs seemed to shine sinisterly as she looked at you.

"Better hope ya never meet me again, shrimp," she threatened, causing Leafeon to rear back a bit,
"... 'Cause next time you do, I'm goin' to eat ya."

With those words that left you as late as the death she promised you, Zorua faded behind the usual illusion that made her invisible.

The giantess that held you in her mouth performed Leaf Blade again, but she ended up hitting the air: Zorua was gone, leaving a startled you and Leafeon behind.

You just hoped you really weren't going to meet her ever again.

Leafeon gently moved back to her bed and lowered her head, letting you fall on top of the soft fabric.

"So, uhm... are you alright?"

--

The agitated Zorua ran through the garden, searching for the way she came in.

She had to get away, find a new hiding spot and wait for the proper moment to steal back that pesky human.

That was it, she only had to get out of here.

Possibly without running into the three other Eeveelutions that were chasing her down.

But little she did know about a certain psychic-type that was wandering around the same garden, searching for Zorua herself...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Saved from the Devil

choices: Zorua snatched you in her mouth and fled!
You dodged Zorua, but she fled anyway!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
The agitated Zorua ran through the garden, her plan already formulating in her mind.

She was going to wait until those damn rats lowered their guards before stealing that shrunken human again.

And she was going to enjoy putting him through hell for ratting her out twice. Oh, yes, she was to enjoy every single moment of his suffering until he begged her to kill him, and she would have happily obeyed.

So lost in gory thoughts, Zorua didn't notice the purple figure of an Espeon suddenly emerging from the sea of green and brown that surrounded the whole place.

And, because of Zorua herself being currently invisible, Espeon didn't notice her either, because the annoying headache that gave no signs of wanting to give her a break still didn't let her psychic powers work properly.

But there was no need to use them, Espeon discovered when a mass of solid air crashed into her.

"Ow!"
"Ow!"

Espeon stumbled back, groaning, before looking at whatever she crashed into; the sight alone made her already huge eyes widen.

The Zorua was staring back at her, her focus broken and her illusion dispelled.

"You again?" the dark-type hissed as a wave of fear began spreading within her.

Hastily, the vixen stumbled on her feet and ran past the purple menace, who looked back.

Espeon watched the black blur running: she tracked Zorua's run before her gaze upturned as she spotted one of Leafeon's pots, which held all sorts of colorful flowers, hanging from the ceiling.

And the Zorua was running straight towards it, until she was right beneath it. Espeon had less than a split second to make her move.

‘Sorry Leafeon,’

With the slightest psychic push, the pot fell right onto the cowardly Zorua, shattering like glass while covering its target in topsoil and ruined flowers.

The Zorua laid motionless after the impact.

"Ow..."

The dark-type moved a paw on her head and began rubbing while mentally cursing Espeon.

The vixen felt soft paw-steps behind her and deduced Espeon was approaching. She attempted to stand back up, but felt a psychic grip surrounding her.

Not only did she stand up again, but Zorua even began floating in mid-air.

"Looks like you're not going anywhere now," Espeon said smugly as she approached the unmoving dark-type.

Zorua growled.

"That's what ya think!" while saying these words, the vixen attempted to use Night Daze.

But Espeon wasn't going to let Zorua's tricks fool her again; the vixen yelped in pain as the psychic grip squeezed her.

"Not the smartest move, was it?" Espeon asked while keeping her smug tone,
"I recommend you don't try anything else, unless you don't want to worsen your situation of course,"

All of a sudden, the psychic-type became aware that the crash drew attention.

‘Obviously.’

A certain grass-type was, in fact, approaching both her and the still struggling Zorua, holding a certain shrunken human on the back of her paw.

"E-Espeon?" Leafeon asked, her eyes darting from Espeon to Zorua, then from Zorua to the destroyed pot as her mind pieced the situation together.

"Um... good job." she praised as your whole being sighed in relief.

Finally, his nightmare was over.

"Did you expect otherwise?" Espeon replied, though you could see from her face that she enjoyed being complimented.

All while Zorua kept flailing uselessly.

"Let. Go." she growled, causing the psychic-type to look at her with a smirk.

"I will... eventually. Sylveon wants a word with you first, Arceus knows why. Then, you can leave this den. Either on your own or being forced to. You pick."

As if on cue, a voice echoed around,

"Espy?" Sylveon's chiming tone resonated, followed by indistinguishable murmuring of Glaceon.

"I've got her!" Espeon responded and, shortly after, the pink ears of Sylveon peeked out from the crevice that was the entrance to this place, followed by her body; Glaceon followed as both entered the garden.

Sylveon's eyes immediately fell on the still struggling Zorua.

"Well, good job Espy," she chimed, before approaching the dark-type vixen.
"Now, you've been quite troublesome, haven't you?"

Her tone was rather gentle, almost sarcastic despite the situation; however, Zorua finally stood still for a moment, responding to the clear provocation with a maniacal grin, which exposed all of her fangs.

"Trust me, y'all," she started.

You kept your eyes glued to her, not missing any word; Leafeon gently placed you on the ground, before she too approached Zorua, in case she had another ace up her metaphorical sleeve.

The vixen paused to snicker. Leafeon had no idea how right she was.

"What's so funny?" Glaceon wondered, seeing nothing funny in Zorua's current situation.

The dark-type's gaze traveled to you.

"This hasn't even begun."

With that, something that made your heart pound your chest happened: Zorua broke free from the psychic that held her still.

Before anyone had time to gasp, she slammed her fore-paws on the ground, crafting an immediate shadow that surrounded the four Eeveelutions and, by extension, you.

In the confusion derivated from the sudden chain of events, no one noticed Zorua walking towards you with that devilish grin of hers.

"Your friend here forgot that psychic doesn't work on dark-types. I had to struggle a bit, but it was worth it!" she declared with a grin. You took a step back.

"Now, if I'm not mistaken, we had some... unfinished business." she spoke her dreadful threat, her canines shining sinisterly each syllable she spoke.

You swallowed in fear while the vixen took another step towards you, her gigantic form looming over your extremely tiny one.

"P-Please-"

"Save it." Zorua interrupted your plead,
"That last stunt you pulled on me was the last one ya ever pulled, ya lil' rat. Trust me."

Time seemed to slow down as a series of things happened at the same time: Zorua leaning down with her mouth hanging open, the shadow she previously crafted dissipating, the four confused Eeveelutions finally becoming aware of what was happening.

But now, they had no hope to avoid your fate; you could only rely on yourself.

Your brain racing, your heart pounding, you tried to jump out of the way...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Unwanted Confrontation

choices: The Eeveelutions decided to keep searching for Zorua!
They were pretty tired, the Eeveelutions decided to give up... for now...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
You watched as the very familiar pink cavern that was Zorua's mouth approached you, her hot smelly breath overwhelming you, its stench working its way in your lungs, which seemed to lose all air.

The four Eeveelutions watched the scene with horrified looks on their faces while the dark-type lowered herself to ground level, ready to take you in and flee...

As the slick tongue darted out of the mouth, your body seemed able to move again.

The paralyzing fear waned, replaced by adrenaline as you made your move and dove out of the way.

Time regained its normal speed as Zorua's fangs closed a centimeter away from your body.

The vixen had barely the time to shoot you a glare, before a chilling gust of wind blew straight into her, sending her flying several feet away from you.

It took you a few moments to realize that, much like she had done earlier, Glaceon used Icy Wind to stop Zorua.

Four gigantic, blue paws missed you slightly as they rushed past you, Glaceon was running in Zorua's direction.

The dark-type hastily stumbled to her feet, before she ran towards the exit of the garden, chased by the ice-type Eeveelution.

After a few moments of being uncertain about whether give chase too or check on you, Sylveon too sprinted after the running vixen and her blue counterpart.

Only Leafeon and Espeon remained behind.

Espeon was rubbing her head after she was subjected to the same attack that dazed her earlier; on the other hand, Leafeon, after several moments of hesitation, lowered herself, her muzzle close to where you currently were.

"Hey..." she whispered, causing you to look back.

"Hey..."

"Are you... alright?" she asked, concerned.

"Ow... of course he is. He's just startled... stupid fluff ball, my head is killing me..." Espeon groaned.

You shot an annoyed glare, despite the fact she was right. Aside from the near heart attack you just experienced, you were relatively unharmed.

Quietly, the timid Leafeon extended a brown paw, halting it in front of you.

Slowly, you climbed on top of the soft back of her paw as she brought it up to her face.

"I... I thought she was going to eat you..." she mused. You wanted to tell her that Zorua's idea was more or less, but no sound came out of your mouth.

Leafeon continued,

"I'm... glad that you are fine human," she said, her muzzle cracking up a smile.

Your eyes lingered on the grass-type Eeveelution for a moment, before you sheepishly returned the smile.

"Thanks." you said, while Espeon rolled her eyes, before emitting another groan of pain.

But before she could further complain about her headache, Glaceon and Sylveon returned to the garden.

And with a knot wrapping itself around your stomach, you noted the lack of a certain giant fox.

"Nothing. She fled again." Sylveon confirmed your thoughts with an annoyed huff.

Glaceon remained silent.

The fairy-type looked at you on Leafeon's paw.

Her expression softened.

"Are you alright?" Sylveon asked as two ribbons hovered towards you, wrapping themselves around your waist before slowly removing you from Leafeon's paw.

The pixie held you in front of her face, and you noted that the serenity and cheerfulness she showed when she gave you the tour of the cave were gone, replaced by a stressed look.

"... Yeah. I'm fine..." you replied as the pink and white giantess nestled you in her chest bow.

"God..." you muttered, not even the silky smooth fur being able to comfort you.
"She wants me... she's going to kill me..."

The thought alone made you go white as Sylveon's own fur.

Zorua spoke her threat, next time you ended up in her paws, she was going to eat you, like Glaceon did, only you probably weren't going to be so lucky as you were in the ice-type's own digestive system.

Leafeon perked up, approaching Sylveon.

"Don't worry, we'll keep you safe!" she exclaimed with a faint shade of pink spreading across her cheeks.
"I-I mean... you need protection, or that horrible Zorua will take you again and will... will eat you..." you had forgotten that Leafeon was present when the dark-type spoke your sentence.

"And how? With those damn illusions of hers... I'm dead, I just know it." you sourly replied while trying to shake off the dreadful image of you melting away in a pool of gastric acid inside Zorua's stomach.

Your mind went back to when you had been trapped inside of her mouth.

It was already horrible back there, being in her stomach couldn't be any better.

"Don't be stupid human, we'll get her." Espeon declared.

"Yeah, we won't let her take you. We gotta stay positive, little one!" Sylveon chimed, though you could tell by her tone that she was trying to self-convince of what she was saying.

Glaceon seemed to finally perk up again, ears shot upwards as she rose her head to look at the other three Eeveelutions.

"Speaking of," she mused,
"Shouldn't we go after that Zorua again?"
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: The sneaky vixen got away! Again!

choices: You decided to go with Sylveon
You decided to go with Leafeon
Another Eeveelution stepped in, having overheard the conversation
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
The wall of fur behind you rose forward as Sylveon inhaled deeply, before letting out a sigh, causing her chest to retract again while nearly breaking both your eardrums.

"I think... I think we should give up, at least for now," she suggested, earning a look of disapproval from Espeon.

"That creepy little-" she paused to let out a grunt, provoked by her headache,
"... is lurking around in our den, and you want to give up?"

Sylveon bit her lip; you did the same.

Letting Zorua be would mean her attempting to snatch you again, which would have disastrous consequences for you.

"It's not like that. We're been chasing her almost all day, Espy, I think we all are hungry and tired." Sylveon patiently explained.

"You're right about that..." Glaceon admitted, her stomach growling softly at the mention of hunger.

Your own stomach growled too, reminding you that you haven't been eating due your time in Zorua's rear... or better, you haven't been eating anything that wasn't under her dirty paws (your stomach contracted violently at the memory).

Leafeon remained silent, but you could tell by the way she was staring at Sylveon that she agreed with the pixie.

Espeon finally relented.

"Fine," she huffed, clearly still determined to go after Zorua,
"Let's go eat something."

As if on cue, a new voice spoke up, resonating within the confines of Leafeon's garden,

"Girls? Are you in here? Are you playing hide and seek?" it sounded feminine, and you recognized it as Vaporeon.

The fairy-type that currently held you sighed.

"No Vaporeon," she replied as a blue quadruped pokemon came inside the bedroom/garden, smiling at the four Eeveelutions in front of her.

"Then what are you all doing in here~?" she asked in a singsong voice.

"We're-" Glaceon was about to speak when Espeon stomped on her paw, earning a grunt of pain and a glare from her victim.

The message was clear though, ‘Shut up’.

"... We were giving the human a tour of the cave!" Sylveon hastily lied, recalling that the tour ended hours ago with your disappearance.

Vaporeon immediately took great interest in you, and rushed in front of Sylveon to observe you up close.

"Hey, aren't you that little guy Glacey ate before Espy sent you in her bladder and she peed herself while you were still inside?" she asked without even breathing.

Instantly, your cheeks flared up; Glaceon's did too as she shot another glare at Espeon, who smirked smugly, struggling to not laugh in her ice-type counterpart's face.

"Uhm... yes?" you replied while Sylveon sighed and Vaporeon began laughing merrily.

"That was hilarious! But you're so incredibly cu-"

"... Vaporeon, what are you doing in my room anyway?" Leafeon interrupted her overexcited water-type counterpart, who immediately pulled her eyes off you to look at the grass-type.

"Oh right! Dinner's ready!" she exclaimed cheerily and, without adding another word, she turned around and began trotting away, leaving you and the four Eeveelutions behind.

"Uhm..." you began, still blushing massively from her unspoken comment and her recalling of what happened with Glaceon.

"... She's certainly..." said ice-type grumbled something under her breath, causing Espeon and Leafeon (though very quietly) to snicker.

"... Energetic," you finished, causing Sylveon to sigh,
"You can say that..." she muttered, before a soft smile appeared on her face.

She was about to reassure you that she and the others weren't going to let Zorua take you again, but she then shook her head: your mind was off that subject right now, bringing her up wasn't a wise move.

"Let's go get something, okay? Then you can get some sleep." she whispered softly as she began walking to the exit of the garden, followed by the other Eeveelutions.

"You look like you could use some."

She had no idea how right she was.

--

While sitting at a table in front of Sylveon, with all the Eeveelutions present - especially Vaporeon, who kept staring at you with that playful grin of hers glued to her face - you learned how quickly today passed while you were being subjected to Zorua's cruel tortures.

It was morning when you first entered the vixen's rear, afternoon when you came out hours later.

Glaceon, Sylveon, Espeon and Leafeon had silently decided to not tell anyone about the the intruder that was currently lurking around in their den, you could tell by the fact that none of the gigantic Eeveelutions had looks of stupor or anger.

All of them didn't seem to mind the presence of a shrunken human at their table. In fact, they seemed like they hardly noticed you: Jolteon, Umbreon and Flareon chatted with each other while eating, Espeon and Glaceon listened to Vaporeon with almost bored expressions on their faces; only Sylveon and Leafeon seemed to be fully focused on you as you ate the bits of food that the first had given you.

The rest of the dinner, and of the evening, passed quietly, while some of the agitation deriving from Zorua's threat began to wane.

Currently, you were riding on top of Sylveon's head, nestled in her head bow as she walked through the hall that led to her bedroom, followed by the the three Eeveelutions that knew about Zorua.

"You know, I was thinking," Sylveon said, abruptly halting while causing the three other pokemon to halt as well.

From your angulation, you could see a bit of Sylveon's face, her baby blue eyes were fixed straight on you.

"... The human should sleep with one of us. Y'know, that Zorua seems to want him..." she recalled, causing you to pale as you remembered the vixen's threat once more.

"I absolutely agree with you." you replied, more than happy to have a giant, fully evolved guardian for the night.

Your thoughts were however distracted as Espeon walked past the fairy-type,

"Good night." she said, disappearing behind a corner while causing you and Sylveon to sigh simultaneously.

Espeon didn't really seem fond of you, you thought as you were reminded that you were here because she wanted to eat you herself when she first brought you here.

She probably lost interest in the thought because the idea of eating someone who had been through someone else's digestive system was repulsive to her.

Glaceon offered an almost dejected shrug.

"He can't stay with me, he'd freeze to death. So... count me out. See y'all in the morning." she explained as she too began walking away, back into her room with ice-covered floor and frosty air.

That only left you with two choices: either Sylveon or Leafeon, who currently wore a blush on her face.

"I'm fine with it..." she muttered quietly, only you able to hear her.

Sylveon smiled,

"I'd be more than willing to help you out, little one," she said, her cheerfulness coming back after being away for most of the day; her gaze went straight back to you,

"And you? What d'you say?" she asked.

You pondered the choice you were given.

Who was your best shot to survive throughout the night?
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Picking a Protector

choices: You woke up during the night - Sylveon was staring at you. What did she want?
You woke up during the night... and discovered that Zorua was in the room!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Ultimately, you decided that Sylveon was your best choice to avoid any nasty pranks from Zorua during the night, which would end with your death if she managed to capture you again.

"I think... I think I'll go with Sylveon." you said.

The face of the fairy-type brightened up, while Leafeon closed her eyes for a brief moment,

"That's alright..." she murmured, before timidly smiling at you,
"G-Good night then..."

Leafeon too began trotting away, leaving you alone with Sylveon, who smiled at you brightly.

"Don't worry little buddy, I'll keep you safe and sound! I won't let that Zorua get you again!" she exclaimed cheerfully, before she too started marching again.

"Thanks..." you muttered in response as you held onto the Eeveelution's head bow, feeling slightly reassured; but at the same time, you couldn't shake off a bad feeling.

You felt like you were constantly watched, and not by the Eeveelutions that decided to protect you; no, you felt her eyes following every little movement you made.

Zorua could be invisible and right behind Sylveon right now for what you knew.

The thought made you shiver, but Sylveon kept going, unaware of your current thoughts, quietly humming to herself much like Leafeon did earlier today, drawing you in her garden.

After a while where nothing was said, Sylveon halted her walk in front of a closed door.

"Hey, wanna end that tour I was giving you?" she asked cheerily, trying to keep your mind off things.
"Little one, welcome to-" the door was opened by one of Sylveon's ribbons, revealing its insides to you,
"My room!"

It was like entering a dream or a tale book, you thought with amazement as you wondered if you were really inside of a cave. All these Eeveelutions were surprisingly civilized for pokemon, there was no denying that, but this was incredible.

Inside, everything looked soft and fluffy.

The room was almost entirely occupied by a large white bed, which was in time occupied by several pink, blue and as well white pillows; the floor was pink-carpeted and the air inside carried a sickeningly sweet scent.

Like... cotton candy?

Many of the fancy-looking pillows were scattered across the floor. Sylveon didn't seem to be one that liked disorder, so you assumed those pillows had their place on the floor for a purpose.

The place was a bit dark, but there were candles all over the place, though you didn't need light to see; this room seemed to sparkle in darkness.

The fairy-type giantess grasped you with two of her ribbons, which coiled around your waist, and lifted you from her head, bringing you in front of her big blue eyes. The humongous oculars sparkled excitedly as their owner stared at you.

"So? Do you like it?" Sylveon asked, her voice carrying a childish excitement as well as a hint of proudness.
"I made everything in here! Even the bed!... Not the candles though, those are still Leafeon's."

Despite everything being quite girly, you couldn't say you didn't like it.

"Y-Yeah," you stuttered, amazed that Sylveon managed to make this all by herself.
"The place looks really nice Sylveon. It looks very comfortable in here."

The giant fairy-type smiled.

"Glad you think that, little one," she said,
"Because this is were we will be spending the night!"

The white and pink Eeveelution made her way to the oversized bed and jumped on top of it, the silky texture shaking under her weight. Sylveon gently put you down, and you discovered that the bed was incredibly soft.

As it looked anyway.

Your giant guardian got comfortable, before she laid down next to you, paws folded under her head.

"Well then, sleep tight human, and don't worry. Everything's gonna be fine." she reassured you, her face inching closer to you as she nuzzled your whole form, before retreating to her original position.

You didn't reply to that, still feeling somewhat bad despite the amazement reigning in your emotions.

But all your struggles weren't enough to fight back the fear you felt, you simply couldn't get rid of it, not when you knew about a certain sadistic vixen that was currently lurking around out there, waiting for you or your guardians to lower your guard to get her paws back on you.

... Heck, for what you knew, Zorua could be hiding in this same room right now! Grinning behind her invisible cover, waiting until Sylveon drifted off to sleep so she could snatch you and carry you away undisturbed.

The mere thought was enough to send chills down your spine.

But, like she had detected your negative feelings, Sylveon opened her eyes to look at you, noticing your startled expression.

"Can't sleep?" she asked in a sweet, almost motherly tone,
"I feel you. I know you're afraid little one, I am too," her ribbon reached out for you while she said this.

The silky smooth ribbon wrapped around you yet again and gently pulled you closer to Sylveon.

"But you don't need to worry, I promise I'm not letting anything bad happen to you, okay?" she reassured cheerily, before she nuzzled you again.

The smile on her face widened.

"If you'd like, I'll help you sleep, too."

Before you could wonder about the meaning of her words, Sylveon raised her head a bit; the ribbon holding you hovered directly to it and it placed you right under the fairy-type's chin.

Then, Sylveon's gigantic head came back down, nestling you in between her face and her paw.

To anyone, this would have seemed like an uncomfortable position to sleep, but you found that you were comfy.

Sylveon's smooth fur was all around you, her soft embrace warming up your whole being.

You flushed red, but couldn't deny that you felt slightly better. Sylveon's presence alone seemed to be like a comforting aura around you, an impenetrable barrier inaccessible for bad thoughts.

"Sleep tight~" the fairy repeated, her eyes closing once more.

Sighing, you emulated her and laid your head against her fur.

Soon enough, sleep came to claim you, and you happily followed it.

Hopefully, everything was going to be okay.
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Pixie guardian

choices: "I'll let ya live shrimp, but you'll have one hell of a time." Zorua declared
"Don't care, lil' bug." Zorua coldly said
You never knew as a noise was heard - someone was coming by?
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Your peaceful sleep lasted for a few hours, aided by unexpected good dreams - did Sylveon's mere presence influence those too?

Sadly, the dream you were having suddenly came to an end as you regained consciousness and were rudely called back from the realm of dreams.

You opened your eyes, immediately recognizing Sylveon's pristine fur, whose cleanliness seemed to pierce the darkness of the room.

The pink and white giantess whose head rested on top of you was still asleep, her nose ejecting waves of warm air and sending them straight towards your face

You yawned and leaned against your fairy-type guardian, enjoying the warmth she emanated and the soothing feeling her presence alone gave you.

You were about to drift off to sleep once more, when a foreign feeling led you to open your eyes again.

The feeling that you were being watched.

Instinctively, you looked up at Sylveon's gigantic face, but the Eeveelution was soundly asleep, her muzzle smiling as she slept; she must have been having good dreams.

However, if Sylveon wasn't the cause of the feeling that kept you awake...

Like an electric shock, a chill traveled down your spine as you felt a gust of warm air hitting you from behind.

You could hear your own heart galloping within your chest as fear washed away the relax in a matter of seconds.

Slowly, to not reveal your very awake state to whoever was watching you, you turned your head backwards to glance across the dark room.

There was nothing out of ordinary, except for a pair of twin blue lights hovering in mid-air, extremely close to where you currently were.

Your heart leaped from your chest to your throat, keeping a deep scream from escaping through your mouth.

She was there. She was watching you. She was waiting from you to wake up the whole time.

"Hello again, lil' rat, did ya miss me?" the dreadful voice of Zorua spoke in a whisper as she leaned in even closer to you.

"I believe we had some... unfinished business. Waddya say if we take care of 'em now?" the vixen whispered again, grinning devilishly.

The only response you wanted you give was a scream that would have surely enough awakened Sylveon, alerting her of the third presence in her room.

Sadly, your vocal chords seemed paralyzed by fear, and you couldn't do anything but watch with sheer terror as the giant dark-type moved one of her red fore-paws towards you.

Before anything happened though, Zorua shot an uncertain gaze at Sylveon.

If she woke up, Zorua herself would catch hell.

After a moment of thought, the vixen shot you a second grin before her form vanished, cloaked behind the usual illusion.

You were finally able to swallow the lump in your throat as you gulped in fear, watching as Sylveon's head suddenly rose from your tiny body.

The pixie smacked her lips in her sleep, but didn't wake up.

With a newfound courage spreading through your body, you attempted to move, wanting to hide underneath Sylveon.

However, before you could even attempt to do so, you felt a wave of hot air assaulting you once more, before you felt something sharp scratching your chest.

Roughly, you were picked up from under Sylveon's head, which was delicately placed back in place by the invisible Zorua.

You stared at your pixie guardian with a sense of dread.

This was your last chance to yell to get her attention.

You inhaled deeply to scream, but no sound came out of your mouth. Why couldn't you scream!?

Zorua seemed to read your mind.

"Don't even think about screaming, shrimp, or I'll bite your head off." she whispered through her clenched teeth, which were currently holding you by the front of your shirt.

You began trembling as Zorua began walking towards the door, you hanging from her lips.

"Take one last look, lil' rat, before I make ya regret squeakin'," that cold whisper filled your ears again.

You gulped in fear.

"P-Please..." you stuttered while you moved dangerously close to the door of the room.

You figured that Zorua was headed outside.

"Nice try, lil' one, but you ain't gonna fool me this time. I've given ya too many chances already. But don't worry," you could practically feel Zorua's grin widening behind you,
"We're gonna have a little fun first. Ya'll learn your place... and then I'll show you it to you - my tummy!"

As if on cue, you heard the stomach of the vixen grumbling softly at the mention, causing her to snicker.

"P-Please, do-don't..." you begged,
"I'd be more useful alive than dead, no?"

"You'd make a darn good snack too, and that's what's gonna happen." Zorua repeated as she finally reached the door of the room, which was slightly ajar.

She opened it without making a noise, before she slipped outside and closed the door again.

And finally, the dark-type reappeared, staring at you with a cold smirk.

"You don't have to do this... I'm sorry!" you tried, trying to talk your way out of this mess.

"I mean, what will you achieve by killing me? Sylveon and the others know about you anyway, you'll only made them more angry if you kill me." you spoke.

The statement caused the vixen to slow down.

The human had a point.

She really wanted to teach him his last lesson, but if she did, those annoying long-eared dogs that inhabited this cave would double the efforts to find her and would probably send her right after the human.

Zorua felt conflicted, but she didn't take long to make a decision.

She looked down at you once more as she resumed walking properly.

The usual whisper began coming out from her gritted teeth as she communicated your sentence,
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Back in the dark paws

choices: You hold out hope for Espeon and Sylveon to save you, stripping yourself of fear
You scream for help, letting the fear take over
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
The Zorua had a way of making your heart sink to the point where its rampant beat felt like it was rattling your whole form, and putting air into your every breath not second too late, you had to give her that. You knew that she knew it, too. If you had already resigned to your deemed fate as the unruly vixen's plaything, and lost the will and the care to be utterly demoralized by half the things that come out of her cavernous, foul-smelling mouth, you doubt she'd be having nearly as much fun with you as she oh so clearly was even behind her steely cover. It's like she feasted on your fear, and perhaps even more so... your humiliation.

And now, she was tearing you away from your cozy, cotton-candy scented refuge, fiercely firm in her promise of literally devouring you once and for all. And it was the most terrifying, humiliating thing in the world.

"So you really don't care at all about getting a target put on your back, then? Being hunted down for the rest of your life sounds fine to you?"

"For the rest of my- Pft, ya kidding me?" Zoura sneered, pulling you ever closer to her maw seemingly by the strength of her derisive snorts alone. "You'll be old news to those rats in a week. Maybe the one with the ribbons will harbor your death as some lingering guilt since... well, it is sorta her fault I got in here in the first place, but otherwise... I'll have already long gotten you out of my system, and they all will keep living out their sad lives, struggling to remember what you even looked like."

Every time her invisible teeth poked a fresh set of holes into your already ruined shirt, your inborn fear of her maw as a mere carnal hazard started to mix more and more with something a lot more sickening. The words that were whisking through those teeth and out of that dark pit of a mouth, as sharp any full set of teeth threatened to be, stung a whole lot on their own, and you could only hope that was the lengths of which her mouth would sting.

The scariest part is that you couldn't really know. The gargantuan dark-type that had you ensnared was nigh impossible to predict on everything but the fact that she would never cease to make your life a living hell, even if meant doing so until there was nothing left of that life. She could decide to graze you with a few of her chompers if she felt so inclined. It wasn't exactly a worse pain than digesting in her gut, you could only imagine.

"T- They won't... They won't forget about m-"

"Can your crisis for a second," she snapped, getting you to do just that by her tone alone. Her voice was still hushed however, saving her from getting caught and your ears from getting blown out. Perhaps it was worth getting your hearing shot as long as Zorua was caught, you realized, though you still couldn't say the same for getting your head bitten off.

"Mm, smells like another rat," she mumbled to herself, sending a jolt of hope through your hanging body. Maybe you could be saved yet!

Before you could even slightly get your hopes up beyond anything more than that, though, you felt yourself get pulled back into a wet. dangerous cavern you've grown to be horrifically familiar with. But this time, the consequences for being tucked away into such an awful place were all the more dire, and not because of the familiar fear of getting eaten alive, but because the already dwindling chances of being discovered before Zorua made it out of the cave were severely hurt. Her body remained invisible up until the point where you were actually within a part of her, you realized the moment you slipped past her gums - a situation only a shrunken human like yourself could afford the disgusting, smelly, stomach-churning "luxury" of experiencing. You were caught under Zorua's own devilish blanket of invisibility, completely against your will. And dang it, you wanted to be seen! To be found! To be rescued!

Not a second after your saliva-drenched body flared up in anger, you were tackled by the Zorua's tongue, becoming somehow even more slathered in disgusting, foul-smelling oodles of the stuff. With your eyes glazed, and mouth hacking to distinguish your own saliva from the nasty pokemon's ever-plentiful supply, you had no real choice but to cling to the fact that your ears still worked. And there was something to listen in on past the sickly sound of spittle and a slimy tongue, albeit an incredibly muffled something. It was still distinguishable, though. Familiar, even.

"You really didn't see anything? Anything at all?!"

"I- No... I don't even think I woke up before.... h- he was gone."

Espeon and Sylveon! They were close! Close enough to hear even beneath the hefty tongue of Zorua! Your heart started racing from a pulse of adrenaline rather than the fear and humiliation your honestly surprised hasn't stopped the organ all together at this point, and you felt that pulse help you put all your might into trying to push up at Zorua's tongue.
