And for a mere second, all of that minuscule might actually felt like it was working, until it all came crashing back down before you could blink... literally.

Such an easy shunning of your efforts sent a harsh message, too. Not just that of how weak and feeble you were, but somehow, coupled with what you could only detect as a hissing laugh in the back of her throat, you got a more nuanced impression than that. Past fighting off the mobile, pink, crushing snake that was her giant tongue, what chance in the world did you have of escaping her mouth? Not only was it guarded by an always at the ready set of life-threatening spikes, but the seal her lips created alone was nothing short of unbreakable with your body soaked in such thick fluids.

Escape was impossible, and unless Espeon's headache had finally cleared up, chances of Zorua's sneaky, nearly imperceptible self getting found out were slim to none.

"She had to of left a trace... somewhere. Is your head clearing up? C- Can you feel anything around?"

"I..."

She paused for a painful while, an agonizing wait for both Sylveon and the close-by shrunken human she didn't even know was such. At least, maybe she didn't know. Something about how long she was taking filled you with a sense of hope as you deeply held your breath, seconds feeling like the most excruciating of minutes.

"...do!"

Your heart leaped, the vixen you were trapped within picking up the pace considerably.

"W- Where? How close?"

You wanted so desperately to shout exactly how close, knowing that with every second that slips by, that closeness becomes less and less close. And unless you did something about it, the feeling Espeon was catching would fade as the pair of Eeeveelutions' words slowly did from what you could hear.

"I can't tell... It's hard to concentrate right now."

Like hell you were going to let that happen, you thought with another surge of confidence. Perhaps Zorua had shifted her priorities from messing with the human in her mouth to running as fast yet discreetly as possible, perhaps you were just that invigorated, but you managed to topple Zorua's tongue, only boosting your confidence all the more.

"Wait, it's stronger! It's a feeling, I think. O- Optimism, almost..."

"Optimism?"

"Confidence, perhaps... It's somewhere by the entrance!"

You gasped a bit in time with blast of air from Zorua, not even caring about the rancid smell it brought to you. Espeon was sensing your emotions! She could find Zorua, and free you from your turmoil before it truly starts!

But the speedy dark-type was making scary amounts of headway through the maze-like cave, and unless the Eeveelutions were quick on the draw, the vixen could still manage out into the wild before they even caught wind of her.

The thought scared you, but it was confidence Espeon was sensing, so you suppressed the fear as fast as it had bubbled up,

"This way, quick!"

You tried to anyway. Some part of you pressed that you would be insane to trust in a spacey psychic-type Eeveelution's fickle ability to feel your very emotions, and couldn't help but consider something drastic in your fear. Something that betrayed your swell of hopeful confidence, as well as Zorua's terrible-meaning wishes. To scream at the top of your lungs for help, even if it meant having your head bitten by the teeth just before you.

But you know it didn't. There was no way Zorua would make such quick work of you after all of the build-up. ...Right?

As you heard a distant yet all too close gale of wind from the outside world, and the close yet all too distant yelling of two scrambling Eeveelutions, you realized that it was now or never to submit to a side of yourself. Trust or complete desperation.
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Under Zorua's Veil

choices: You managed to grab onto Zorua's uvula!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Ultimately, you realized that the second a request of help left your mouth, your whole head would be bitten off by the sharp white razors that surrounded you, only for your corpse to be then sent on a one-way trip to a death chamber you were all too familiar with, having already passed through someone's digestive system.

That left you with no other choice but hope Espeon and Sylveon were able to track Zorua.

You inhaled deeply, not caring if it meant sending the disgusting stench that lingered in Zorua's mouth straight to your lungs; to avoid slipping into fear, you began telling yourself that you were still fine, that the Eeveelutions were going to find you and the murderous Zorua they intended to make a snack out of you.

The thought was a dreadful one, but you fought back fear by mustering as much courage as you could.

You're going to get out.

You're going to be fine.

Zorua's gonna be caught.

Your mind kept thinking about comforting thoughts, and fear slowly began to wane.

"... I feel... hope! Come on!" the voice of Espeon sounded now much closer.

By this point, the one fearing was the same Zorua that held you in her mouth.

The vixen hastily sped through the cave and finally ran outside, a gust of cold wind greeting her to the outside world.

Gaining some confidence from the newfound freedom, Zorua began running even faster.

Cold air reached your small form through her closed lips, causing a sliver of fear to find you once more.

You quickly suppressed the feeling and kept telling yourself that you were gonna get out of here alive if you just stayed calm.

"We're close!" a voice, which you recognized as Espeon's rang from somewhere really close to where you currently were.

Zorua panicked, the two Eeveelutions behind her were gaining ground, to the point where she could hear their paw-steps right behind hers.

She glanced backwards, noticing Sylveon and Espeon catching up with her quite fast.

She had to think of something, quick...

As Sylveon and Espeon got closer and closer, the dark-type did the only thing she could think of and went to dive behind some bushes.

She knew they couldn't fool Espeon, but she thought that if she just kept changing course, the two long-eared pokemon were going to lose her sooner or later.

Sadly (and luckily for you), Zorua only managed to jump halfway to the bushes.

"THERE!"

A beam of light was shot towards the invisible vixen, piercing the darkness; pain took over Zorua as she was hit by the attack, which dispelled her illusion, unmasking her while also causing her to fly several feet back.

Your slick and sticky surroundings shook as the vixen flew across the air and landed with a painful thud, causing you to land as well, but on her tongue, mercifully far from her teeth but dangerously close to her throat.

Hastily, you attempted to crawl back, but the mouth began shaking around you again: Zorua was getting back on her feet.

Groaning, the dark-type stood up and glared at the two Eeveelutions in front of her while realizing that she was completely uncovered.

Fighting was not an option, she knew, Sylveon and Espeon were fully evolved, the first had a type advantage and it would be a two-on-one anyway. There was no way Zorua could win.

Before your captor could further contemplate her options, she found the ground suddenly missing from beneath her paws.

"If you're thinking about getting away again, forget it." Espeon harshly told as she lifted the dark-type in mid-air with Psychic.

The two Eeveelutions got closer.

"There will be no more surprises from you, I'm afraid." Sylveon told as her ribbons extended forward, wrapping around Zorua's forelegs, hind legs, neck and muzzle.

The vixen was completely unable to move.

In desperation, Zorua began flailing uselessly against the psychic grip that held her, but no avail.

Inside her mouth, you breathed in relief, crawling back from the abyss that would lead to your demise if you ever fell into it.

Finally, you thought, you were safe... as soon as you got out of this smelly, fleshy and utterly dangerous hell.

Sylveon took another step closer to her and Espeon's ‘prisoner’.

"The human." she told, her head nearing the vixen's,
"... I am going to let you open your mouth and give him back."

The statement caused Zorua's eyes to sparkle evilly, though Sylveon didn't notice it.

She had almost forgotten about the critter in the confusion... but there he was, still in her mouth, completely at her mercy.

‘But not for long...’

She might have been caught, she thought, but these two rats weren't getting their own rat back.

Just as she told, Sylveon unwrapped her ribbon from the muzzle of the vixen, expecting her to groan and open her mouth; what she didn't expect to see was Zorua grinning murderously, before she began snickering.

"Say bye-bye!" she told, letting your body be seen by Sylveon and Espeon, before she shut her mouth once more and began tilting her head backwards.

Sylveon and Espeon gasped, while you screamed in terror: Zorua was about to swallow!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: The edge of the abyss

choices: Too late! The acids began digesting you...
You were able to move to the intestines, avoiding digestion!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Time seemed to slow down.

Muffled screams penetrated your slick prison as it shook while it was tilted downwards, causing you to slide towards your dreaded destination: the back of Zorua's mouth, where that deep dark abyss that was her throat was located.

You desperately tried to move, but your body simply won't, paralyzed by a strong fear as it was.

Your feet entered the tight opening, its slimy, slick muscles gripped your lower body and began dragging it down.

Finally, time seemed to regain its normal speed.

You screamed in terror as you were sucked up to your waist into the abyss, which kept consuming your body, like it had a wish of devouring you as much as its owner did.

And, with one forceful gulp from Zorua, your body was ultimately sent past the tight opening and into the esophagus, embarked on a one-way journey that will surely end with an ending of your own...

Outside, Sylveon watched with horror the lump that has suddenly formed on the other side of the still hovering, tied-up Zorua's throat, realizing that her little human friend was just swallowed.

The dark-type vixen snickered maliciously.

"Whoops... my bad~" she told, her voice adopting a very childish time that only served to get Zorua more on Espeon's nerves; Sylveon was far beyond horrified to care.

In the meantime, you traveled down a tight, fleshy passage that smelt obnoxiously; the stench of the Zorua's past meals stung your nose, and the sticky saliva invaded each and every inch of your body, but you couldn't care less about these facts.

Your mind was instead completely focused on another, more important fact - you were just eaten! Again!

Terrified, you tried to look downwards, noticing that your descent towards the vixen's stomach was being rather slow.

If you could just...

An idea sprang up in your mind, you could still save yourself!

Hastily, you spread out your limbs, pushing them against the walls of Zorua's esophagus in order to halt your fall.

For a moment, it seemed to work, and you found yourself snugly wedged between the fleshy walls; but your incoming wave of relief was pushed back down in the pit of your stomach as Zorua gulped once more, sending saliva raining on you as well as making the esophagus slippery enough to cause your arms and legs to slip.

With terror showing itself again, you noted that your descent has resumed.

Beneath you, a sealed opening gaped open, revealing a lake of colorless steaming liquid waiting for the incoming meal - you.

You could do nothing but tremble in fear as you slid down, past the gaping hole, splashing into the ‘pool’.

The opening sealed tight after your entrance, blocking one of your ways out.

You emerged from the lake of gastric acid and spat out some of the liquid, sitting in the middle of the empty stomach in disbelief.

Zorua's once threat became a reality, and very probably the last reality you'll ever live: she had swallowed you, dooming you to a nearly certain fate.

Your brain worked crazily to try and find a way you could use to escape this fleshy, steaming hell, but every way you could think of seemed simply impossible.

You sighed defeated, swimming back to one of the walls of the stomach, waiting for your fate while also surrendering to the atrocious reality: you didn't know what to do.

--

Still hovering in mid-air but no longer tied by Sylveon's ribbons, Zorua watched with deep satisfaction as Espeon waved a paw in front of her immobilized fairy-type counterpart's face, trying to remain calm.

"Your friend there doesn't look too alright, ain't I right?" the vixen snickered, earning a simple response from Espeon,

"Shut up." the psychic-type told, before returning to Sylveon,
"Syl-"

The pixie seemed to spring back to life all of a sudden,

"That's it!" she exclaimed, scaring the hell out of Espeon.

Before the psychic-type Eeveelution could recover from the surprise, Sylveon moved in front of her.

"Teleport, Espeon!" she ordered,
"Teleport the human out, like you did with Glaceon!"

Sylveon's words sank into the other Eeveelution, who blinked, before shaking her head in an almost resigned fashion.

"I can't." she bluntly told, pointing to the trapped Zorua with a paw,
"She's not like Glaceon. She's a dark-type, teleport wouldn't work. It's already a miracle I'm being able to hold her."

Sylveon's ears dropped; Zorua laughed.

"That's right, ya rats!" she taunted,
"So might as well let me go, no? Your lil' friend down there will come out eventually... just in another form!"

The comment only made Espeon glare and Sylveon snarl.

"Let you go?" the psychic-type parroted back in annoyance,
"Fine. But on my terms!"

With that, the invisible grip holding Zorua began spinning her around in circles.

The vixen barked in protest as she began gaining speed, more and more speed as Espeon got ready to launch her across the forest. And finally-

"STOP!" Sylveon shouted a second before Espeon could throw Zorua away like an old rag doll.

"We need her. We could still get the human out." the fairy-type explained to her confused counterpart, who slowed the dark-type fox down, leaving a very dizzy Zorua hovering several feet away from the duo.

"There's no way we could, Sylveon. Unless we beat him out of her, but I refuse to lay my paws anywhere near her." Espeon smugly told.

"Ugh... right back at ya..."

Sylveon sighed, her kind mind fixed on what you were experiencing right now... if you weren't already reduced to nothing but a bloodied corpse traveling across the Zorua's digestive system.

She shuddered at the thought.

"Let's... let's wait anyway," she suggested, her cheeks growing a shade of red,
"... He could make it... y'know, like with Glaceon?"

Espeon winced.

"Disgusting."

--

Against what Sylveon had imagined, you weren't dead yet.

Your held your breath as your body bathed under the surface of the digestive juices, which were starting to give off a tingling sensation, but you didn't care.

A newfound idea to escape this hell had come in your mind a while ago, and you were now trying with all your might to pry the hole leading to Zorua's intestines open.

A gross way out, but the only one available, you mentally told yourself.

It was no easy task: the sphincter was shut, and it was giving no signs of wanting to open anytime soon; it was like nature itself was trying to stop your efforts to get out of the Zorua.

The tingling sensation became stronger each second more you spent in the stomach, causing you to pound on the opening in desperation.

At some point though, you ran out of breath and had to surface, taking in a disgusting mouthful of the foul smelling air that lingered in the stomach before diving again, resuming your work on the sealed opening.

By this point, the acids began burning your skin, suggesting that the digestion has started; but, at the same time, the hole seemed to give away a little.

You mentally cheered, but it wasn't done just yet.

Quick, you didn't have much time left...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: A trip down the Zorua

choices: Sylveon wanted to talk to Zorua first...
Zorua suddenly broke free and escaped into the woods!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Time was quickly running out, you knew it, it wasn't going to be long before the acids were go to be your end.

Startled, with your body beginning to grow tired and your vision blurry, you focused the last of your strength on the tight opening in front you; you already hasty efforts became frenetic, then from frenetic they became desperate.

You kept on trying prying the hole open, but it required quite the effort, because it was sealed.

The acids around began burning, only causing your desperation to increase and your hope to wane.

You were going to die in here! In the stomach of a random Zorua, only because you made the mistake of agreeing to doing that stupid tour!

You fought back tears, your hands desperately trying to open up the hole, just enough for you to slip through so you could save yourself...

As if fate itself was listening to your prayers, it decided to finally show mercy: just as the acids became unbearably hot, the hole suddenly shot open, as if having developed a mind of its own and wanting to help you in your escape from its sadistic, murderous owner.

Before you knew it, you were sucked through the opening; you were plunged into a damp, slick and slimy place. The fleshy walls pulsed slowly around you, like they were trying to chew Zorua's latest meal again.

The hole sealed tightly behind you.

Air, albeit foul-smelling and utterly disgusting, began filling your poor lungs.

Disgusted, exhausted and with the acids leftovers still burning your skin, you began wiping the tingling liquid off your skin, tiny, colorless droplets splashing onto the already wet walls of Zorua's small intestine.

Only when your body began feeling slightly better, you let yourself fall on your rear.

You would have gladly continued on your quest to get out of the vixen who had eaten you as soon as possible, but you simply couldn't move anymore, your wave of adrenaline having died down.

Beaten, half-dead and tired from your struggles and the lack of sleep, you laid there unmoving.

You needed rest.

--

"Is he still alive?" Sylveon asked anxiously, worried for her little friend's fate.

She had woken up earlier, only to find that the human she intended to keep safe was gone; in a matter of minutes, she had gotten Espeon who, albeit annoyed because she was woken up, was more than willing to chase Zorua down.

Said vixen snickered deviously, her laughter striking both annoyance and fear into the poor fairy-type Eeveelution, and only annoyance into the smug psychic-type that wished nothing more than to throw the little vixen across the forest with a psychic flip.

"Wouldn't count on it too much if was ya, believe me." Zorua chimed in, only to get a simple reply from Espeon,

"Shut it, you creep." she coldly stated, before focusing her psychic powers.

Because of her being a dark-type, sensing Zorua was complicated; but the tiny presence inside of her wasn't.

Espeon wore a surprised look.

"R-Relief...?" she stammered in confusion,
"Fear... hope... the human is-"

"He's alive!" Sylveon exclaimed happily, relied seeping in her body - her human friend made it!

As for your current host, she fluttered in disbelief.

She couldn't believe it. And how could she? The human was supposed to be nothing but a bloody mess right now!

Sylveon's related expression fell back into a frown as she stared Zorua down.

"Now, let's wait," she addressed Espeon without making eye contact, her eyes fixing a stern glare into Zorua,
"And when he comes out, we'll see what to do with her."

Espeon wore a rather menacing grin on her face.

"I have quite a few ideas what to do with that little creep..." she hinted cynically, causing the vixen to gulp.

This wasn't go to be her best outcome... unless she came up with something real smart real quick.

She couldn't keep the human to escape, and she couldn't keep these two rats from getting him back.

She could, however, still come up with something to escape.

But she wasn't going to give up on the morsel in her intestines. She would eventually come back, get the little human back and make sure he was good and deceased the next time.

--

Endless hours of being trapped in a slick, smelly and absolutely disgusting passage passed.

From Zorua's small intestine, you eventually slipped into her large intestine; the moment you did, the muscles became tighter and clamped down on you like hungry maws.

Quite surely, you passed out from exhaustion at some point, waking up after what had to be several hours later, you could tell by your current environment tighter than even, rectal fluids entirely covering your body; but what caused your body to swell with joy was the tight, puckered opening that laid not too far from you.

Adrenaline spread through your body like a shockwave.

Not want to spend more than a few seconds more in here, you hastily began crawling through the last of Zorua's (luckily) empty digestive system, which took quite the effort due it being extremely tight.

Only after several minutes, you managed to reach the opening, which easily towered above you.

Gingerly, you reached out for the imposing anus and touched it, trying to open it to get out.

In the meantime, outside, your current host grunted as she felt an odd feeling - nature's call.

"D-Damn ya..." Zorua mumbled, sweat beginning to roll down her face.

Espeon, who, alongside Sylveon had stayed awake all night, turned her head in disgust.

"There it is."

Sylveon didn't reply, but waited, expecting to see your body popping out of the vixen at any moment.

And eventually, it happened.

The large hole in front of you opened, allowing the faint light of dawn to peek inside for a brief moment, before your body was gripped by the large anus which, pulsing slowly, began pushing you out of the dark-type fox.

Your face went first, followed by your whole head, then chest, torso, waist and, eventually, lower body.

Gravity worked against you, dragging you down in a great fall towards a patch of slightly damp grass, which cushioned your landing.

You groaned, sore from the impact and in general, while the vixen you were ejected from panted above you.

Shortly after your landing, you felt something oddly soft coiling around you, like a soft blanket, which began rising you up in the air... since when did blankets fly on their own?

Your eyes opened, your view filling with a comforting sight - Sylveon, whose ribbons were holding you in front of her, although at a a foot from her.

It was hard to see why, given the state you were in.

"There you are." she spoke softly, almost motherly. It was like you were a baby pokemon that had just hatched from the egg.

"Are you alright, little one?" the giant fairy-type asked, causing Espeon to huff in disgust beside her.

"You mean, aside having just been-" the psychic-type trailed off, disgusted, though slightly relieved to see you alive.

You shot the psychic Eeveelution a glare, before sighing.

"Y-Yeah... kind of..." you replied to Sylveon's question.

Sylveon's smile faded, and her eyes shifted on the red-faced Zorua, who fluttered there, held by Psychic, shooting the two Eeveelutions and you a glare, a silent declaration of contempt.

"As for you..."

This time, Espeon firmly stepped forward, staring the vixen straight in the eye,

"Allow me."
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Deeper within the vixen

choices: You woke up, finding Zorua in the garden...
You woke up, noticing Leafeon awake and staring at you
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
While pondering your options, a brief image floated across your mind, almost like a reminder.

In your head, you saw yourself dangling from the mouth of a certain green pokemon as she hit Zorua with a Leaf Blade, showing she was equipped with a considerable amount of strength despite her character; not only that though, she's also shown to be really caring, perhaps not as much as Sylveon but still enough to not handle you to Zorua back then.

Yep, you decided, Leafeon would be a good protector for you.

"Um," you spoke from the top of Sylveon's head,
"I think I'll go with Leafeon."

Simultaneously, Sylveon pouted and Leafeon blushed.

"That's fine..." the latter muttered under her breath, though she felt flattered on the inside.

Sylveon sighed.

"Fine." she said.

One of her ribbons came to your perch and wrapped around your waist, lifting you from the silky smooth white 'ground' to bring you in front of the familiar blue pools that were the pixie giantess' eyes.

Sylveon cracked a smile.

"So... see you in the morning, buddy," she said, her ribbon moving towards Leafeon, who bent her head obediently, letting her fairy-type counterpart place you down on the top of her head, right by her leaf,
"Try to stay safe. And... good night."

"You too." you replied, feeling uneasy: Sylveon's disappointment was palpable. Leafeon, who was quiet throughout the whole conversation, muttered a quiet 'Good night' before turning to walk in the opposite direction.

Left behind, Sylveon waited for the grass-type to disappear behind a corner before sighing, having lost the little human she grew so fond of.

He may have had his reasons, she thought while she too turned to walk to her bedroom, but she still was disappointed about it.

--

Silently, Leafeon walked across the cave, towards her garden; her tiny passenger was being just as quiet as her.

She walked past a few other Eeveelutions and eventually arrived to the opening in the roots that led to her garden.

"You might want to, um, lower your head." she advised.

You followed what she said as she squeezed herself through the small opening.

The scent of grass hit your nostrils as Leafeon started to venture deeper into what was a jungle to you; the Eeveelution avoided what remained of a pot that was previously broken by Espeon to stop Zorua, deciding she was going to clean the mess later on.

For now, she had someone she wanted to talk to.

Both you and Leafeon remained silent for the rest of the trip to the end of the garden, where the pokemon's bed rested in a corner.

Blushing vaguely, the grass-type Eeveelution jumped on top of it, nearly throwing you off of her head, which she then lowered slowly, letting you climb down onto her muzzle and on then on the bed, right in front of her humongous face.

Again, that sinking feeling of powerlessness showed up, causing you to take a step back.

That's when you noticed that Leafeon was blushing.

"So... why me?" she bluntly asked, her creamy cheeks growing a deep red shade.

You too blushed.

"Well, I guess... because you'd be able to keep me safe. You've done it once..." you admitted, before smiling awkwardly,
"Now that I think about it, I've never said thanks..."

Leafeon smiled.

"It was nothing, really," she replied, though you could tell she enjoyed being thanked.

"So now... we should go to sleep. You've had a long day, haven't you?" she said.

"You can say that." you replied, before feeling a huge weight in your heart: Zorua was still out there in the den and, until she was finally caught, this long day you've had was gonna become a routine you feared.

Not to mention that the vixen was now after your head...

Discomfort assaulted you and led you to look down.

Leafeon noticed this.

"You're afraid..." she stated the obvious.

You bit your lip and nodded, before glancing up again,

"How can I not be? She wants to kill me and I can't do anything about it, Leafeon. It's... frightening." you said.

The green giantess remained silent for a couple moments, pondering the right choice of words to reply to your confession.

"Maybe not you," she said in the end, leaning in closer,
"But you have us. We'll eventually get her before she gets you, you don't need to worry... too much."

The words so kindly spoken made you feel slightly better. You managed to crack a smile and look up at the towering Leafeon.

"Thanks..."

The green giantess flushed red and returned the smile, before she began moving on the bed. She settled down and moved one of her brown paws towards you.

"Come on, let's go to sleep now." she repeated; her paw slid behind your back, her soft pad pressed against your back and pulled you closer to her muzzle.

Not without having blushed again, Leafeon pushed you up against her cheek and laid still.

"Try to catch some sleep. Good night." she said.

You nodded.

"Yeah... good night, Leafeon."

You quieted down, letting yourself enjoy the warmth and smoothness that surrounded you.

Your eyes closed and, shortly after, your mind drifted off to sleep from the exhaustive day you've had.
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: A night in the green

1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
You were shocked from your sleep, finding nothing to protect you from the crisp cave air that greeted you back to the waking realm. You instinctually closed your form into a ball to try and make do with the warmth your internal hearth provided, but in all honestly, you weren't really too perturbed by the cold. It contrasted nicely with the horrible nightmare you had awoken from, you having been entrapped behind a certain fennec's canines, very nearly suffocating under oodles of spit and an unrelenting wave of palpable heat however native it was to your subconscious...

Maybe that's why you woke up - you did suffocate, your subconscious not even bothering to humor the idea of depicting you slipping down into the monstrous pokemon's gullet, either out of pessimism that you'd even make it that far, or because you had tucked the idea of getting swallowed up by Zorua so deep-down that your nightmares couldn't even be bothered to tap into it.

Perhaps that was for the best, anyway. Had the nightmare taken you farther down into the dark-type, you couldn't imagine you would've woken up as relatively composed as you did, and you didn't want to have to trouble a sleeping giant so late at night...

When you bothered to unfurl your body, though, and looking around on the expansive bed you laid on, you realized there was no 'sleeping giant' to trouble in the first place. You were alone on the stretch of fabric, the lingering imprint of where the Leafeon had slept off most of the night being the only trace of her. Had you not known any better, you would've assumed she left you alone in her room all together, but you did know better. You already felt her gaze from up above, meeting it quickly with a slight rise of embarrassment. Though, by the look in her eyes, and the rosiness to her cheeks, it was evident you weren't the only one feeling such.

"S- Sorry, did I wake you?" she whispered like there was still a sleeping human to be mindful of, paws pattering on her perch.

"No, you're fine. Just... didn't like where a nightmare was headed, I guess."

Something changed in the Leafeon's eyes, a drop of caramel spreading in the hazel of her irises, before she closed them all together. "...Was it about... erm... Y'know..."

You puffed. "You would think my brain would be a little more subtle, but yeah... It was about her. Way too much about her." you said, pulling down on a part of your face with a palm like it would smooth out your stress.

"I- It wasn't that she was just the villain in some bigger story?" Her head dipped lower, paws coming off the end of her oaken perch. "Nobody else was there... It was all her?"

"...She ate me, Leafeon. All the dream was is me getting gobbled up by her and drowning in her saliva. Because apparently even in sleep I can't have a break from thinking what she's going to do when she gets her paws on me." you let out, throwing up your arms with enough vigor to already make you want to curl back up and doze off again.

Leafeon grimaced before jumping down, sending a familiar scent out into the air as well as bouncing you up like the bed was a aromatic trampoline. Sure sounded like a place where you could never have a sour thought, but your mind begged to differ ten times over, addled by the brief nightmare that, even so, acted like a gift that kept on giving.

That is, a gift like what a Delibird would give, except in this scenario there were a hundred Delibirds and they were all throwing presents at you relentlessly without a chance of any of them healing y-

"You okay, little one? You look... spooked."

Oh yeah... Psychic-type, you thought with bleeding sarcasm, though you were earnestly glad to be broken from your own inner-hysterics.

"It's just.... I don't know if I can keep going like this, Leafeon. As long as Zorua's still out there... as long my life is constantly on the line... I don't know if I can bring myself to feel safe. Even here, in your... tree-den... garden thing."

She giggled a bit, leaves loosening up from the blades they were beginning to become.. "I like that... Even in here." she let out just barely, a fresh couple of roses blooming by her small smile.

"It is nice in here, I'll admit. It... smells both like a forest and bouquet of flowers." you complemented with buds of your own forming on your face, wishing you could just leave it at that and bask in the sunniness of the Eeveelution's reserved yet affable reaction. "B- But Zorua's already proved she can get in here, and there's no way she's going to let me slip through her paws again. It's not like this place is any safer than it was last night."

"Who says?" came a familiar voice, so sudden and considerably louder than Leafeon's own hushed tone that it caused you to jump like you had been bounced again. You felt your heartrate return to its previous speed as you looked to the where to voice had come from. Heck, maybe it even settled back to normal.

Through a doorway was another hollowed out tree filled with a intricate pattern of flowers, and at its center were a trio of familiar Eeveelutions, except with a few additional features.

"W- Wha... Hey, don't pick my flowers!" Leafeon cried, leaves rustling in a surprising showcase of frustration. You supposed if there was anything that was going to get the timid gardener to raise her voice, it would be three of her company picking some of her flowers and putting bunches of them in their fur.

"C'mon, what'd you expect? You're the one you who made us take an all-nighter in your treehouse just so we could.... What is it we're doing here again?" Glaceon turned to the Espeon and Sylveon, a periwinkle drooping out from behind her ear.

"We're here to protect the little guy, of course! Plus, Leafeon, us wearing flowers will help distinguish us if Zorua tries to pull another disguise. Little one, I'm only the real Sylveon if I have hibiscus in my bow, petunias at the ends of my ribbons, and a hollyhock in my tail, mhkay?" she sang, flaunting her features and their freshly-added flowers.

"Oka-"

"Oh so noo~oow it's about distinguishing you from Zorua. I thought you wanted to 'embrace what makes you unique from other Sylveon'." Espeon snarkily butted in, though she too sported a few purple flowers of her own, excepting two stray instances of black and blue.

"Says the one who-"

You rolled your eyes, managing to tune out their conversation and return you focus to a pretty frazzled looking Leafeon.

"S- Sorry, they can get kind of rowdy sometimes."

"I'm... used to it. I'm just surprised they even agreed to this. Well, I'm surprised Glaceon and Espeon agreed, Sylveon I get."

"....It was my idea, actually." she murmured, that familiar pink tint returning to her face.

"Really?" You were legitimately taken aback, especially considering how bashful the grass-type typically was.

"Yeah, I... I guess I couldn't stand you getting caught by that monster again. Especially if I was under my watch... I.... tired my best to just sleep my worries off, but when I did manage to doze off... I had a really bad nightmare."

"You too?!"

She nodded quickly, ears poised and eyes held near-shut. "Sorry I didn't tell you. I figured it would only make you more scared if I told what happened in it."

"...I'm sure I could've handled it... I mean, they're just dreams right?"

Leafeon paused at that, letting her tail sway as if she was mulling something over. "Yeah.... that's the thing." She lowered herself to your level, giving you a good enough look at her hazel eyes to see the striking concern at their centers, perhaps the solidified form of the sap spreading within them before.

"I don't think it was just an ordinary dream, little one. Nor was yours. The dream I had... all I saw was that Zorua. You weren't even there... It's like the dream wasn't even coming from me. Especially not because.... the Zorua, she had this horrible grin on her face."

"Can't see how she wouldn't be smiling like that in a nightmare."

"I- It wasn't just the smile, though. It was her eyes. It's like she knew I was seeing her, and the fact of that alone was pleasing... Like she had gotten just what she wanted simply by being there..."

Suddenly, it clicked. No wonder the nightmare felt so haunting, so suffocatingly Zorua-centric. She'd found a way into both you and the Eeveelutions' dreams! She was using your own subconscious to remind you of her and your fate at every sleeping moment!

"How did she... God, isn't haunting me during the daytime enough for her?!"

That borderline cry is what finally caught the attention of the arguing Eeveelutions in the other room, replacing their back-and-forth with utter silence. Slowly but surely, they made their way closer to Leafeon's bed, settling down just at its side. They each wore a distinct expression on their face. Sylveon's was one of bewilderment mixed with worry, mouth slightly agape. Glaceon's was a dull as ever, but there was some worry wading around in the pools of her half-lidded eyes. And Espeon's seemed... almost knowing, eyes glistening with some strange form of regret. So many eyes on you and not a single word spoken. That was until...

"Finally made it!" called a voice from the entrance, getting everyone to look at the new Eeveelution that was just barely managing to squeeze through the passageway of tangled roots. It was...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Worry Seed

choices: ... nothing happened. She was the real Vaporeon, alright
... an illusion dropped; she was not Vaporeon. Not at all...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
For several moments, the newcomer remained unseen, though the sound of crushed leaves and the rustling of the grass below signaled that they were getting closer to your location.

And, finally, a certain azure pokemon jumped out of the bushes and in front of the four Eeveelutions (and you).

"V-Vaporeon?" Leafeon stuttered while the water-type proceeded further into the garden and placed herself right in front of her counterparts with an enthusiastic smile on her face.

"Hey, y'all!" she exclaimed cheerfully,
"What are you all doing up in the middle of the night?"

Your giant protectors exchanged looks of hesitation; you knew why: Vaporeon didn't know about Zorua.

"Um... we are..." Sylveon attempted to come up with a decent explanation. However, Vaporeon lost interest before she could offer any,
"Hey, why are you all wearing flowers? Even you, Espy... Leafeon, are you giving your flowers away?"

"Wh- no!"

Espeon sighed.

"Vaporeon." she began as calmly as she could,
"Tell me, why exactly are you here right now and not in bed?"

Vaporeon's smile made a comeback.

"I heard you all walking out of my room and I saw you, Sylveon and Glaceon coming here, so I decided to follow you!" she explained, before shooting a second glance at her counterparts,
"What's with the flowers anyway?" she repeated.

"These? We need 'em to prot-" Glaceon was interrupted when someone screamed,

"Glaceon!"

Everyone turned their heads towards you, who let out the scream. Panic was written all over your face.

Glaceon tilted her head, confused.

"What?" she asked in a calm, almost annoyed tone.

In response, you gritted your teeth and shot Vaporeon a nervous glance, before looking back at the ice-type, wondering how you could express what was in your mind without actually telling.

Then it came you.

Targeted by multiple perplexed stares, you shot Espeon a glance. If the purple giantess could read your mind for just a moment...

"What's wrong?" Sylveon asked concerned,
"You look like you've seen a ghost..."

You didn't reply, but looked at Espeon intently, without speaking a single word.

None of them seemed to understand your line of thinking, but Vaporeon could easily be a smart disguise for the devilish Zorua you've narrowly escaped earlier today. She had no flowers on her, but you couldn't tell if she was Zorua or not, because Vaporeon came by after Sylveon explained her plan. You probably just kept Glaceon from telling Zorua, saving yourself if your supposition was true.

All the Eeveelutions gathered around you, wearing concerned expressions... annoyed in Espeon's case, since you were staring at her like you would stare at a certain vixen...

"What?" she asked, finally taking notice that something was wrong with you; seeing that you weren't speaking made her feel annoyed,
"Aw come on! Out with it!" she exclaimed, nearly deafening you.

You didn't obey and Espeon sighed in frustration.

Leafeon seemed to understand though.

Slowly, she leaned forward, her muzzle stopping right in front of you,
"Have you seen... her?" she whispered, so that only you could hear what she said.

You shook your head.

Leafeon blinked.

"What's wrong, then?" she asked, concerned.

You gulped, giving up your plan to get Espeon to read your mind.

"Leafeon..." you whispered,
"Vaporeon..."

"What's up with the human?" the Eeveelution you were trying to warn the others about spoke to her counterparts in an annoyed fashion, interrupting you while causing Leafeon to look back at the water-type.

"He's acting weird! That's weirder than that noise I heard on my way here! When I went to check, there was nothing!" she exclaimed.

Instantly, the attention of everyone was on the blue pokemon; the others adopted astonished expressions. Espeon frowned.

"A-A noise?" Sylveon stuttered,
"Where have heard it?"

Vaporeon tilted her head, her smile waning as she understood that, whatever was going on, the situation was serious.

"In the hallway..." she murmured.

Though she was extremely vague, further explanations weren't necessary for Espeon, who darted towards the entrance of the garden at full speed.

After a moment of hesitation, Glaceon and Sylveon followed; only Leafeon and Vaporeon remained with you.

The former seemed to hesitate for a while longer, before deciding that her help might be needed as well, so she began walking towards the root gate, not before having spoken to Vaporeon,

"W-Watch the human. W-We'll be back."

With that, Leafeon too left.

Your heart froze the moment you saw the verdant pokemon disappearing past the roots that led into this garden.

Now you were alone with a pokemon that possibly wasn't what she appeared to be; and if Vaporeon really wasn't what she appeared to be, you would be dead within the next hour, depending if Zorua wanted to enjoy torturing you before ending your life.

Vaporeon blinked a few moments, before silently looking back at you.

Several minutes passed and...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Concealed threat?

choices: Vaporeon carried you into her own room to have some fun
The others came back... with Zorua!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
As time and silence drew on, nothing seemed to happen.

You expected Vaporeon to melt at any moment to reveal the devilish Zorua you feared so much, but it never happened. The blue quadruped simply sat in front of you with her long tail wagging slowly and a polite smile on her face.

You began to tranquilize a bit as you realized that maybe your fears were unwarranted.

"So, um... everything alright? You're being kinda quiet." she said, tilting her head to the side.

The sudden interruption of the silence made you perk up.

"Yeah. Everything's fine." you replied, wondering if you should still worry that Vaporeon might still be a disguised Zorua, luring you into a false sense of security just to enjoy your reaction more the moment she revealed herself to you.

The mere thought made you shudder as you instinctively backed away.

Vaporeon noticed that something was wrong with the tiny human she was ordered to watch.

"Hey, you cold? You're shivering, " she said in a concerned tone, walking over to Leafeon's bed where you were sitting. With a swift leap, she was on top with you and lowered her muzzle to you, who found yourself eye to eye with the blue giantess; her eyes were so big compared to you that you could clearly see the face of a startled human in there - yours.
"Or maybe you're afraid! What are you afraid of, lil' one, of big me? D'you just think I'll gobble you up?" she half laughed.

'And here's another mind reader...' you sarcastically thought, still wary of this titaness. But still, you had no proof she was who you thought, but you couldn't lower your guard until the others came back.

"Yeah, kind of..." you decided to at least talk to Vaporeon,
"Everything is sorta gigantic and... well..."

You had to lie.

While it was true that everything being gigantic was utterly frightening, it was nothing compared to the gigantic vixen who wanted your head; Vaporeon, if she was the real one, knew nothing about Zorua and you didn't want to be the one to deliver such news.

She'd probably think you were nuts if you did.

The giantess seemed to buy your words, because she offered a smile that was meant to be at the same time comforting and pitiful.

"Ah, you don't need to be afraid, little one!" she encouraged, offering a smile,
"I mean, just because Glacey ate you it doesn't mean you have to be scared all the time!"

You didn't want to tell her that Glaceon wasn't the problem right now, heck she was even nice once you got some time with her!

"I'm not..." you muttered under your breath.

"Speakin' of," Vaporeon continued, changing subject,
"How'd ya get so small? Humans are a lot bigger than that, no? Unless... were you born like that? Are you a pup!?" she asked with gleaming eyes.

Jeez, did this water-shooting pokemon ever stop talking?

"No no," you replied, a bit annoyed,
"I just kinda... woke up like this earlier, in the forest. Espeon found me and, well, you know how things went." you explained,
'Though not all of it...'

Perhaps it was better if she stayed clueless, you figured, who knew how long she could go on if she knew about Zorua. All you wanted to do now was to sleep, but you were forced to stay with a chat box that seemed intent on keeping you from catching five more minutes of shut-eye.

You sighed, feeling bad for thinking such things. Vaporeon had nothing to do with this, you wouldn't have been able to sleep anyway. Not with that vixen in your mind.

The blue giantess lowered herself.

"Why that long face?" she asked.

You sighed again.

"Vaporeon, look," you began,
"Things have been going a bit too fast for me. I'm trying to sort this out, really, but I simply... can't. My size is gone, and then all of you come in, it's... it's... a bit too much to take in right now, that's all."

Of course, you left out the part where you were being threatened by a-

You shook your head. You didn't want to think about her any longer or you were never going to sleep tonight.

The water-type next to you smiled.

"No need to worry!" she exclaimed cheerfully,
"Me and the others are here! Nothing's gonna happen to you while you're here!"

You wished you could convince yourself of her words, but the threat that lurked in this cave was clear.

Until Sylveon and the others didn't manage to catch that angry, hungry vixen that was in turn hunting for you, you were never going to relax fully. Because, the moment you lowered your guard and so did your giant guardians, you'd be nothing but fox food.

If only you never agreed to do that stupid your with Sylveon...

Your thoughts were interrupted when something slick and damp pushed into you; looking up, you saw Vaporeon nuzzling you into her cheek in a friendly gesture, trying to cheer you up.

You couldn't help but flush red and cracked a smile.

She was the true Vaporeon, you assumed, or she would have already eaten you.

And, quite contrary to who you assumed she was before, this one giantess wasn't so bad.

Perhaps, once you were freed from that black and red fiend in the shape of a fox, your stay here wasn't going to be so bed.
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Cooling down

choices: "... We should get some breakfast. We'll think better with our stomachs full."
"... Let's wait for the others to wake up, then we'll see..."
"... We should lay off for now. Zorua will come out, eventually..."
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
Seeing you with an awkward smile on your face only made Vaporeon's own smile grow wider as she noted that her efforts to cheer up this tiny human fella that stumbled in the Eeveelutions' cave were actually working.

"Ah, see? That's much better!" she happily said,
"You can always count on friends to help!"

You scoffed.

"We practically just met." you remarked.

Vaporeon gave a friendly smile.

"That means nothing. If you're going to stay here, might as well be friends, no?" she offered.

Huh. You didn't see it that way since Espeon got you in this cave, though you've been in contact with definitely friendly Eeveelutions such as Sylveon and Leafeon.

The proposal itself didn't sound bad, but it was very odd when spoken from a pokemon to a shrunken human.

"You're right..." you conceded. Vaporeon's smile shrank into a sweeter expression.
"Great. You'll see, we're gonna be the best friends e-"

"Vaporeon?" a familiar chiming voice interrupted,
"What are you doing?"

"Eugh, I bet she's trying to make the human surf on the ground." another voice sarcastically spoke.

Vaporeon's ears perked.

"Now here's an idea!" she spoke while eyeing a quartet of familiar Eeveelutions approaching both her and you.

Sylveon, Espeon, Glaceon and Leafeon all stopped near the latter's bed where you and your blue guardian have been. You noticed that all of them wore different expressions: Sylveon looked worried, Leafeon dejected, Glaceon deadpan and Espeon carried an annoyed expression on her face.

"Any luck?" you spoke, Vaporeon shooting you a curious look.

Sylveon simply shook her head in response.

"We've searched around, but there was nothing. I think you were hearing thighs, Vaporeon." Glace on addressed her water-type counterpart.

"I'm sure I heard something..." Vaporeon replied, cocking her head to the side,
"What's with you all, anyway? You look like you've seen a ghost-type."

In response to that, the gaze of the four Eeveelutions landed on you.

You got the message after a little bit: they all wanted to know whether it was safe or not to assume Vaporeon was really Vaporeon.

You gave a quick nod.

Sylveon sighed.

"It's nothing, Vaporeon, we're fine. Just... here..."

"Hey, stop that at once!" Leafeon complained as she watched Sylveon extending two of her ribbons to pull two colorful flowers, placing them behind Vaporeon's ears.

"Hey, that does look cute! Thanks!" she cheered

The fairy-type yawned in response.

"I need to sleep." she declared.

"Same here."

"I wouldn't mind that..."

Feeling cut out, you decided to find yourself a corner on Leafeon's bed and try to catch some sleep yourself.

However, the moment you found a spot for yourself and laid down, the whole bed shook beneath you and a shadow was cast over you: Sylveon had jumped on and was staring at you with a smile as well as a blush.

"I'm afraid that won't do, small one," she said, leaning closer to whisper in your ear,
"If we're gonna protect you, we'll have to do that the best we can, no?"

"... Yeah?" you replied, seeing no holes in such logic.

Sylveon's blush became brighter.

"Well, it'll be harder for that pesky Zorua to get you if I just do this..." she said, one of her ribbons coiling around you and bringing you to its owner's chest bow, where she nestled you before laying down,
"Good night."

You couldn't help but blush a bit, feeling like Sylveon's been looking forward this.

"Yeah... good night..." you muttered while another landing made the bed quake again: Leafeon joined the other two Eeveelutions and you on top while Espeon and Glaceon simply remained at the bottom of the bed.

Five, fully evolved pokemon against a lone, still unevolved one would be a pretty unfair match, you mused, but at least you'd be safe.

From your 'cage' you shot Leafeon a look, noting that she was staring at you with a gaze that told 'Everything is gonna be fine' and a small smile on her face.

You smiled back, silently thanking her for the encouragement.

Then, you close your eyes.

Shortly after, sleep claimed you.

--

Unlike before, when your sleep was tormented by a certain vixen, you managed to sleep soundly throughout the night.

The next morning, Sylveon was the one waking you up by gently shaking your body with her ribbon.

You moaned softly, then yawned and, in the end, opened your eyes to stare right into the azure ones of the white and pink giantess.

"... Oh, hey..." you greeted, somewhat relieved you were still with her and that those blue eyes didn't belong to Zorua,
"What time is it?"

"It's morning." she replied. You noted she was displaying an unusually serious expression and you could clearly see through her forced smile. You also noted that everyone else around you was still asleep as there were a cream and green giantess and a blue one still snoozing on the bed next to where you and Sylveon were standing.

"Listen," she said to you as she lowered herself a bit so that she wouldn't wake the others,
"I woke you up because I wanted to talk. We need to discuss options about... well, you of course."

You frowned.

"You're still thinking about her?"

"Don't tell me you aren't..." Sylveon replied with a sudden frown. You were suddenly reminded of your nightmare and agreed with her,
"Good point. But what should we do? That Zorua is really tricky and won't stop until she gets me and..." you interrupted go yourself.

"She won't." Sylveon said, nudging you with her muzzle,
"And, as for what we should do... I was kinda hoping you'd have a suggestion..."

"Me?" you replied,
"I don't know this cave like you and I never had to deal with giant pokemon before so... I'm just as clueless as you are."

Sylveon sighed.

"Great."

After that, both of you went silent, and the silence, interrupted only by the snoring of the other four Eeveelutions, was fully broken when the fairy-type one spoke again after two minutes,

"Wait, I think I've got an idea..." she said.

"You know how to get her?" you asked, your interest perked; sadly, Sylveon shook her head.

"... About what, then?" you asked again, disappointed.

"Hey, not everything is gotta be about her now, does it?" she remarked, before wearing a smile,
"And I'm thinking..."
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: A good night's sleep

choices: She decides to swallow you down. You've been too much trouble for her.
Before she can decide, the others return, having run into the REAL Vaporeon
She decides to keep you. These last few days have been fun. (away from cave)
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
For several seconds, everything was quiet, the sound of the others' footsteps fading in the distance.

"Well, that was easy..."

"Vaporeon" said, before her illusion dropped, leaving a smug Zorua in her place.

"I didn't even have to mention some dark shape in the corner of my eye, or something."

She said, before looking back at you with a grin. You back away from her, keeping on backing away as she follows you, until you bump into the wall.

Licking her lips, she bends down so that you are face to face.

"Well, time to deal with you, little rat~"

You close your eyes as she opens her mouth, sticking out her tongue and giving you a lick. Humming in joy, she closed her mouth around you, slurping you into her mouth. Sucking on you and moving you around in her mouth, she considered what to do next.
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: ... an illusion dropped; she was not Vaporeon. ...

choices: They told Umbreon everything. He could be of help
They decided against it. Better if the word didn't spread...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.content:
With everyone's eyes pointed on itself, the figure of a Pokemon with black fur covered in golden rings managed to squeeze through the entrance.

Umbreon.

You looked in between the gigantic Eeveelutions that had you surrounded, but they were paying attention to the newcomer.

You didn't really meet Umbreon so far, you only really saw them twice. Heck, you didn't even have a clear idea of their gender yet, though you seemed to remember them being male.

Umbreon didn't seem to mind you since he hadn't spoken a word about you while you were eating with the Eeveelutions.

It wasn't like you were a friend, nor you were a foe. You were simply indifferent to the black furred titan, perhaps a nuisance so little you could just be ignored.

Leafeon was the first to speak up,

"U... Umbreon?" she stammered.

The red-eyed Eeveelution shook the dirt off of their fur, before finally speaking,

"Ow... dude, you should make that opening bigger..." he moaned, looking behind himself,
"Wonder how you can even squeeze through that..." he muttered afterwards, ears twitching.

There was silence for a few moments, everyone just looking at the dark-type Eeveelution, too busy contemplating what he could possibly be doing here at such hour.

It was honestly no surprise that Umbreon was still awake, though his being here did raise a few questions.

Why he was here seemed a good one to begin with.

When Umbreon finally noticed that everyone, you included, was simply staring at him, he turned around.

"Well? What's with everyone? Why are you just looking at me?" he asked, a bit annoyed by the stares everyone were giving him; that's when he spotted you on Leafeon's bed and said,
"Oh, there's the human. Hey dude."

You were surprised to be addressed so casually.

"Hey..." you shakily replied.

"Umbreon." Espeon finally spoke up, sounding politely firm,
"What are you doing here?"

"I could ask you the same," Umbreon replied, though there was no hostility in his voice, only, if you had to make a guess, a disinterested curiosity,
"I just came back from my walk outside and I heard y'all talking, so I decided to come and check."

"Ain't you a lady killer?" Glaceon commented teasingly, causing the dark-type to roll his eyes.

"Oh, ha ha."

While the conversation among the Eeveelutions began warming up, you just kept staring at Umbreon in silence, having no place in their conversation.

He seemed friendly enough, at least from the way he greeted you and from the way he talked with the others.

There was a detail that caught your eye: the complete lack of flowers in the giant's black fur.

Instinct immediately let you jump to conclusions and told you that his may have been a trap of a certain illusion-crafting vixen whose objective was to catch you, but then logic prevailed. Certainly, Umbreon could not know about the strategy Sylveon and the others made up, so he was justified...

Or was he not? This could still be only a convincing façade, though you didn't want to point your finger until you were sure.

You looked around, noticing that Leafeon was being very quiet.

"Hey, Leafeon," you called, getting her to fix her hazel eyes on you,
"Hm?"

You motioned for her to lean closer, which she did, lowering her massive head towards where you were standing.

"What is it, small one?" she asked in a concerned you.

You swallowed your fears.

"Listen. It's only a concern I have, but..." you shot Umbreon a stare,
"What if Umbreon... is not actually Umbreon?"

Leafeon turned her head to stare at you, perplexed, until she pieced it together and got the picture.

"You're not saying..." she muttered, looking at Umbreon for a moment before her gaze returned to you.

You nodded slowly.

Wordlessly, Leafeon got back up and walked over Espeon, whispering in ear for a couple seconds; the psychic-type looked at her her grass-type counterpart, before frowning and looking at Umbreon, who was talking to Sylveon.

"So... what's with the flow-" he was saying, but got interrupted.

"Hey Umbreon!" Espeon called,
"What were you doing this morning, huh?"

Umbreon blinked.

"This morning? Nothing special. I was asleep most of the time. Why?" he asked back.

Espeon didn't relent.

"Oh, I dunno... been chasing a small human lately?" she asked.

Everyone looked at her.

Umbreon looked beyond confused now.

"You mean, him?" he asked, pointing a paw at you,
"Why would I chase him? Especially not after he came out of Glacey's-"

"Shut up!" Glaceon roared, her cheeks flaring up, while Sylveon made a disgusted face and Espeon began laughing.

As an argument began, Leafeon and Espeon walked back to you.

"There you have it." the latter commented with a smug smirk,
"That's undoubtedly Umbreon."

"I mean, if you're sure..." you replied, guessing these giantesses could recognize Umbreon more than you did.

Luckily, he was no Zorua...

An idea sprang up.

"But hey, now that he could help us," you said to the two titanesses,
"He's an all-nighter, isn't he?"

"He is." Leafeon agreed.

"Then, why not have him search for Zorua? She wouldn't expect him to search for her, right? You just gotta tell him..."

Leafeon and Espeon looked at each other, silently pondering your suggestion, before looking at Umbreon, who had resumed speaking the others normally.

Maybe your plan was worth a shot...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213331.title: Inquisitive shade

choices: The room was deserted aside from Zorua and you...
Sylveon, Espeon and Glaceon were in the room!
The room was occupied by... the real Flareon?
1142222222222221122112222111221221213332.content:
"I..." you started, but quickly shut your mouth as your gaze traveled sideways; there, from the dark end of the hallway where Zorua went, two icy eyes stared straight at you, waiting for you to speak, dooming yourself to an horrible fate the next time the vixen got her paws anywhere near you...

"... I didn't see her..." you hesitated.

Espeon looked at you, skeptical.

For a brief second, time seemed to stand still as the eyes of the psychic-type glowed.

And you felt a lingering pain in your head: Espeon was trying to force herself inside your mind.

She grunted - she was having a hard time. Normally, a human wouldn't be able to resist mind-reading, but Zorua's attack weakened her powers; to make things worse, the human was afraid - no wonder why, shrunken and between three giantesses - and his fear kept her out of his head.

She sighed as she decided to give up, her own head was killing her.

Espeon looked at Sylveon.

"Let's go. Zorua must be somewhere around here..." she said, Sylveon nodded.

Both pokemon turned around and sprinted at the same time. Glaceon was about to do the same, when she realized that you were still being held against her chest by her paw.

She bit her lip - she had to give you to someone else if she had to go after Zorua too.

Without thinking nor talking, the ice-type started walking.

Left alone in her hiding spot, Zorua snickered, listening carefully to check if any of her three chasers were close.

Nothing.

She smirked, and slowly came out, cloaking herself in an illusion as she, once again, became invisible.

Then, the vixen started walking.

--

"So... where are we going exactly?" you asked Glaceon, who was walking in a hallway. The ice-type looked at you.
"I'll... I'm going after Zorua too." she revealed.

You looked at her, momentarily forgetting the death promise you were made.

"Hey, what about me?" you asked, wondering how Glaceon was going to chase the dark-type vixen with you kept against her chest. Plus, you were starting to feel really cold, and Glaceon's paw, as soft as it was, was pressing against your exposed chest.

The ice-type didn't answer: she was looking in front of her.

"Oh, Flareon," she asked, suddenly nervous. Your own gaze traveled forward too, and you took notice of the fire-type Glaceon mentioned, coming your way.

Before the red pokemon with creamy fur could talk, Glaceon released you and placed you on the floor as gently as she could.

"Do me a favor - watch him." the blue pokemon hastily said, without waiting for an answer as she turned around and sprinted away.

You stared at the point where she was not even a second ago, blinking, not quite sure of what you just saw happening before your eyes.

Slowly, you turned around and raised your head to look at the looming, confused-looking Flareon.

He looked back at you.

"So... ehm..." you paused as you noted something weird: Flareon was grinning at you devilishly.

"Hello there." he spoke with a frighteningly familiar voice.

You paled and backed up as the red pokemon shrunk, his - her - fur changing color as it went from bright red and creamy to black and dark red.

A yell rose from the depths of your heart, but it was pushed back down your throat by a red paw pinning you down before it could even reach your mouth.

Zorua snickered.

"And so ya didn't rat me out... good, good lil’ rat. I'll keep that in mind..." you didn't know if it was appreciation or sarcasm in her voice.

"... Why walk around like that? Why not be invisible?" you simply had to ask. For a moment, Zorua's smirk faded.

"Because your purple friend was this close-" she opened an extremely tiny space between her toes, giving you a clear visual of the dirt that once again clinged to her paw,
"...To finding me. I had to play it safe... but now, that's not important."

The paw was removed from your body, but it was replaced by something worse: Zorua's mouth, which darted towards you, opening wide in the split second before it reached you.

Again, you were plunged into the dark insides of her fang-filled oral cavity, which she closed around your fragile form.

You tried to scream - not that it would have made any difference except for making Zorua angry - but you were silenced as you received a disgusting mouthful of saliva which fell from the fleshy ceiling.

You spat it out as your surroundings started to shake.

Zorua, now back in the body of Flareon, was walking again.

Now, she only had to find a place to hide in this incredibly spacious cavern. She didn't want to go back into the forest and, until someone found her again, she could hide in here freely... having more perverted ‘fun’ with her human slave.

A sudden realization: since she fled from there... and it was technically a secret... no one was going to check the room where Sylveon hid her for two days before your arrival, right?

Smirking, the ‘fire-type’ started walking towards the secret room, you uselessly struggling in her mouth.

Luckily, the vixen encountered none of the Eeveelutions that resided in the cave and, eventually, Zorua reached the very familiar secret room...
1142222222222221122112222111221221213332.title: Back in the paws of the Devil

choices: You’re not doing this! You won’t let the fox control you!
You’re not testing Zorua. Agree to pleasure her.
Run away! Hide with her toys or run to the door—just get out of there!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213332.content:
With you in her mouth and fun on her mind, Zorua strutted into her secret room. Zorua, currently cloaked with illusions — in the guise of Flareon — thought her plan was infallible. To her, the red-orange puffball’s brains were as fluffy as his fur. Zorua reckoned the other Eeveelutions thought the same. Any excuse would be a plausible excuse. She always had one.
         And even if she was caught in here — who cares? It was easy to play dumb. Especially if others expected you to be dumb.
         Zorua’s swagger paused mid-stride. She had entered her former room and spotted the guest she least expected to see.
         “Wow…” Flareon said. A Fluffy Tail he was doing who-knows-what with dropped from his mouth. “It’s like looking in one of Glaceon’s ice mirrors!” He paused to quizzically tilt his head. “Only it’s not me… it’s me but not-me…”
         Zorua looked to him, stupefied.
         “Hello Not-Me!” Flareon cheerfully greeted. “So, are you like another Flareon who just happens to look like me? Or are you—gasp—my long-lost twin brother!” Flareon transitioned to a clearly-audible stage whisper, “Haha! I knew I had one! Suck it Jolteon!”
         For the first time in her life, Zorua couldn’t think of something to say. All she did was pin you against the ridged roof of her mouth. You squirm, beating your hands against the muscle. Her slimy tongue squashed your resistance with a callous squeeze and a pretty clear implied threat: squeak and you’re sleeping with the fishes I ate earlier.
         “Y’know, I always wanted to answer this question: what is the sound of one paw clapping? If we both use our right paw, it should be the same paw because we’re the same person, right? So, if we both—waaiiitt… why aren’t you talking? Are you mute?” Flareon’s ears dip like a wilted flame.
         Zorua finally recomposed herself. A deft movement of her tongue kicked you into the pocket of her cheek. You bounced off the fleshy wall and fell into a murky puddle of slobber. A cage of fangs separated you from the rest of her maw.
         “‘Naw.” Zorua said, moving her mouth little as possible.
         “Oh!”
         “I’m...uh…you.”
         “I knew it!”
         “...from the future.” At this, Flareon gasped.
         “If you’re from the future, you know everything that’s going to happen! What am I going to eat for breakfast tomorrow?”
         “The same thing ya ate yesterday.”
         Flareon’s eyes went wide. “Just like I did the day before…”
         Zorua grew impatient. “Look — I’m not here to play Q&A. I’ve got, uh, serious business. Saving the world ‘n stuff.”
         Flareon’s tail wagged like a cotton ball in a windstorm. “Me? Saving the world? I’m so cool in the future!”
         “Ya, and I gotta ask ya to leave. To stop timey-wimey stuff from happenin’.” Zorua cleared the doorway and put on her coolest face. She was really starting to get into the role, as weird as it may be. “And you gotta pretend nothin’ happened here, you see? Paradoxicals⁠—or something, y’know? If others find out, the future changes and I go poof! And I’m you, so yeah.”
         Flareon jittered with excitement.
         “You got it, me! If anyone asks where I’ve been, I’ll just say I was here,” Flareon points a paw to the ground, “and saw nobody but myself!”
         “...Good boy.”
         And with that, Flareon picked up that Fluffy Tail and sauntered away. Zorua didn’t say a word until the pitter-patter of his footsteps faded into nothing. After an infinity of waiting in your dark tuna-scented pocket, a surge of warm air blasted past you as Zorua spoke at last.
         “...that boy ain't right.” She said before spitting you onto the cream-colored carpet. Landing with splatter, your arms were weighed heavily with slobber.
         “You’re not gonna run, are ya?” She said smirking and wriggling her toe pads in front of you. You shielded yourself as bits of dust from between her toes rub off and flutter down, sprinkling you in the strangest shower. A cruel chuckle bubbled up Zorua’s throat.
         “That’s what I thought.” she said. She retracted her forepaw and laid down in front of you, front legs tucked under her neck-fluff. Her head was far too close for your comfort. You could feel the warmth and moisture of her breath wash over your like a rolling cloud.
         “Look, pipsqueak: I’m gonna get outta here and you’re comin’ with me. The rest of the folk here are a bit wiser than Sizzles there. My silver tongue don’t work with a mouthful. So, the whole carryin’-you-in-the-mouth-thing, that’s a no-go.” A devilish smile cut across her face, “but y’know first-hand there’s more places to keep a rat, hmm?” Her black-and-red tail whipped behind her. She sniffed.
         “Y’know the first rule for travelin’ with pets? Make sure they’re nice and tuckered before you do any of that travelin’. I’m a stickler for the rules, so I’m gonna make sure I do a nice number on ya.” You saw her lick her fangs from behind her gums.
         “Wait!” you plead, “you don’t have to do that!” Zorua doesn’t even flinch. She simply licked the back of her paw and grooms the little hair-tufts on the side of her cheeks.
         “I know I don’t have to,” she said nonchalantly as paused her grooming and looked you in the eye, donning a paper-thin mask of uninterestedness. “...But I really do want to.”
         A gleam in her eye filled your veins with ice. “Is there anything else you can do?” You managed to say.
         “Hmm, no. But you can do something.” She went back to licking the back of her paw.
         Desperate, you ask, “what is it? What do I do?”
         Zorua donned a warm smile, more fake than a counterfeit portrait. Once more, she put a stop to her grooming and gave you a little wink. She sat up on her haunches with a small grunt.
         “I’m feelin’ a little tired myself. Evadin’ eight Eeveelutions ought to make anyone tuckered. You understand, right?” It’s then when you notice you do not like how far her legs are spread apart….
         “Anyway, you need tirin’ out and I need some energizin’. So,” she said as her paw dipped down to her nether regions, “you’re gonna do the hard work for me.” Zorua’s smile melted into something diabolical, “Now get over here and put some fire in my blood.”
         You wanted no part in this. You took a single step back before Zorua clicked her tongue in disapproval.
         “Y’know if you’re not feeling this we could always do somethin’ else.” She sighed mockingly. “But I have a feelin’ you ain’t gonna like what else I’ve got in store….”
         You really didn’t want to give in to the vixen’s perversions, but was it worth risking her cooking up an even worse torment?
1142222222222221122112222111221221213332.title: Flareon Meets Flareon

choices: Use her trusty Flareon disguise to hide in plain sight.
Sneak around and be careful not to make a sound! Get out unseen!
1142222222222221122112222111221221213332.content:
You didn’t even have to say a word for Zorua to read you like children’s book.
         “Good rat,” she said. With a look, she commanded you to come closer. You obeyed. Her gaze lingered on you as you approached—piercing, oppressive. It rivaled that of a Mean Look. Though Zorua can’t learn Mean Look—it didn’t matter to you. Its effect was the same: you had no chance of escape.
         As you stood between her red-and-black legs and faced her gray belly, you look up: at her. Really, you just wanted to look anywhere but there.
         Zorua was hiding it well but her mouth was watering up from anticipation. She swallowed. It was louder, more obvious than she intended. She decided to use this moment.
         “Heard that, rat? You better do a fine job. Mess up, and instead of here,” she gestured to her nethers, “you’re gonna drown in here.” She patted her stomach with a soft plumpf. For a moment you thought to say something clever, but you repressed it with a swallow of your own.
         Zorua smirked, “Nothin’ smart to say? Good. Toys don’t talk. Rats only squeal. Get to work.” Her final words hit with a gravity like from another world and sucked your soul into a black hole. Like a lifeless puppet, you broke eye-contact and walked forward and placed a hand on the furs of her crotch. Biting your tongue, you brush her fur to find what lay behind the undergrowth. All the while, the strangest thought cropped into your head: you can’t believe how soft her fur is… Only Sylveon’s was softer….
         You stared her vulva in the face. For a moment—strange as it was—you were unsure of what to do. Were you really just going to crawl in? Behind you, Zorua’s left paw began drumming impatiently. You made your choice before Zorua could make it for you.
         You stuck your hand in. Disgust creeped up your arm like a contagion. Zorua pleasantly hummed above. The drumming stopped.
         You take a deep breath, ignoring the mind-clouding scent. Your other arm grabbed the side of her sex stretched it open. You could easily fit.
         Zorua’s tail thumped behind her. In impatience? Excitement? You didn’t dwell on it. You just shoved yourself in.
         Halfway in, halfway out. Walls of slick flesh, drenched in foul fluid, assaulted you. They tried to snatch you away from the outside world like that of a starving beast swallowing long-awaited scraps. Zorua moaned as her tummy flattened, trying to curb her desire. She wanted you to do the work, afterall.
         You’re still only partially within. You wriggled yourself in deeper—all the way. Every movement you made the tunnel twitched, convulsed, or pulsed.
         Zorua breathed deep as her heart and tail had a drumming competition. This feeling she felt. This conquering feeling. She ruled you. You had no choice but to obey. At this moment, she was your queen. With a twitch she could make you bark. With a word she could make you submit. And her breathing, the sound of rushing blood—those were the only sounds you heard. She was your world.
You were claimed. A tunnel of love never felt so devoid of care. Crushing, compressing — unpleasant. The air: sultry, steamy — oppressive. The innards of her cunt constricted around you as the vixen moaned.
         “Mrawr,” she purred. Her sigh came from all directions like the voice of a goddess. “Oooh, thi-this is good. I g-gotta get up. Gonna make this better, real good...” You didn’t have the energy nor the mindspace the process what she said. You’re just trying to survive. You felt a sense of vertigo as Zorua must’ve stood up all fours. You pound your fists against the wall and only make things tighter as Zorua bucked her hips.
         After a hellish infinity, you heard faint shuffling from outside. Zorua was moving something? Pushing things? Grabbing something? Your questions were answered as you sensed Zorua arch her back and tilted her behind toward the floor. Your confinement whipped as Zorua’s bottom hurtled toward the floor. A brief glimpse of light, Zorua’s vagina opened. An ivory stick lunged toward you. You narrowly avoid being skewered as the cavern around you squeezed with an infamothable tightness, leaving you pinned between the interloping object and the wet walls.
         “Oohhhhh,” Zorua couldn’t contain herself. Beneath her was a Poké Toy fashioned in the likeness of a Mincinno’s tail. She took ragged breaths as she rocked her bottom up and down, up and down. Her belly pressed in and out, crumpling and relaxing as her privates grew ever tighter. She felt you squirm, struggling against your new hell. And it drove her up the wall.
         Everything was dark, wet, and tight. Up and down you and Zorua went. The toy, slick, glided out and in—far deeper in Zorua than you’d ever wish to know. A crushing pulse rocked Zorua—threatening to make both you and Zorua pop. Then it happened again. And again.
         Orgasm encroaching, Zorua tried to block to dam the flood best she could—but she knew it would burst. In her final act, she slammed her bottom to the ground. And then she let the flood free.
